loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 50, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ordialyn, a jeepney driver, and a mother to their two children. By the grace of God, Avelina has managed to support her child's schooling. Her two children have already settled down with their own families. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Avelina oversees operations of their jeepney* transportation business. They have one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which are paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1,000 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20,000 loans. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and spare parts of their jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Avelina hopes to have another vehicle some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*Curiously, Jeepney has purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw out the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepney is one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

**All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 50 years old and lives in San Jose, Sinacaban. She is married with 4 children. 
Melissa has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 10 years. Melissa requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Melissa has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Melissa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr: Mor est un jeune agriculteur  qui a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Il est marié et père de famille. Il habite à environ 22 km de la ville principale. Il y possède un champ ou il fait du maraichage. Il sollicite son 3ème crédit  dans l’institution et cela pour acheter des semences de choux et des intrants agricoles (gasoil, engrais) .Mor démarre  sa journée à 8 h pour la terminer à 18h. Il gère la dépense quotidienne de la famille. Et avec les revenus de son activité il peut  améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille et réussi même à épargner. Car il voudrait ouvrir une boutique de produits agricoles dans l’avenir.
texts.en: Mor is a young farmer with more than 10 years experience in this domain. He is married and a father. He lives approximately 22 km from the main town. He owns a field where he practices market gardening. He is requesting his third loan with the institution and this to buy cabbage seeds and agricultural inputs (diesel oil, fertilizer). Mor starts his day at 8am and finishes at 6pm. He manages his family's daily expenses. And with the income from his business he can improve the nutritional conditions of the family and even manages to save. Because he would like to open a store selling agricultural products in the future.

loans.use: to buy cabbage seeds and agricultural inputs (diesel oil, fertilizer).

loans.name: Jaquelin  Karina

texts.es:
Jaqueline vive en la ciudad de chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza porque es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, así como también porque sus pobladores son muy conocidos por la buena sazón que tienen para la preparación de platillos. Jaqueline convive junto a su pareja el cual trabaja como profesor y sus dos hijos  cuyas edades comprenden doce y diez años a los cuales ama muchísimo y son su alegría y su razón de vivir y por los cuales da la vida y se esfuerza por salir adelante cada día.

Con mucho esfuerzo Jaqueline inicio su negocio de preparación y venta de dulces como tortas, alfajores, panes, gelatinas, entre otros; ella se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 8 horas,  ella tiene una buena sazón para los dulces y por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio, además de atender con mucha amabilidad a sus clientes ya que la mayoría son niños y siempre les tiene paciencia.

Jaqueline está muy agradecida con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su horno, comprar un horno mas y comprar utensilios de repostería, lo que le permitirá poder elaborar más dulces de manera más  rápida y tener mejores utensilios para realizar mejor su trabajo, así ella seguirá luchando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener su empresa de repostería y panadería y preparar los mejores dulces de su ciudad y sobre todo darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Jaqueline lives in the city of Chincha, which is known as the cradle of Peruvian athletes. The people there are also very well known for their tasty food. Jaqueline lives with her husband, a teacher, and their two children, ages 10 and 12, whom she loves very much. They are her source of happiness and her reason to live, and it's because of them that she works hard every day to get ahead.

With a lot of hard work Jaqueline started a business making and selling sweets like cakes, alfajores, breads, puddings and other things. She works about 8 hours a day at her business. She has a good taste for sweets and she thinks that's why her business is going well, along with her friendly customer service. Most of her customers are children and she's always patient with them.

Jaqueline is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to do maintenance on her oven, buy another oven, and buy other implements for baking that will allow her to make more treats more quickly and have better equipment to do her work. She will keep working in order to achieve her dream - "having a pastry and bakery business and making the best sweets in the city, and above all giving her children an occupation."

loans.use: to buy equipment for a bakery.

loans.name: Marcos Humberto

texts.es:
Marcos vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, a los cuales ama mucho en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido, hermosas playas , así como también por su agricultura en especial del cultivo de arroz, así mismo se le conoce por se una ciudad donde se cocinan los ricos camarones.  Marcos en su tiempo libre le gusta ir a pescar, ya que lo relaja mucho y lo distrae de las preocupaciones; como buen peruano le gusta la comida típica de nuestro país por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Pollo a la Braza”; Marcos solo tuvo estudios primarios, por ello trabaja mucho para hacer que sus hijos sean mejores que el y tengan un buen porvenir.

Con mucho esfuerzo el trabaja como maestro constructor, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias, dependiendo del tamaño y tipo de construcción que realice, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo y los acabados en sus construcciones son muy buenos y bonitos, por ello sus clientes siempre lo recomiendan.

Marcos está muy agradecido y feliz por la ayuda brindada por los prestatarios kiva, ya que con su apoyo el podrá comprar madera y herramientas( comba, martillos, espatulas para tarrajeo entre otros) para poder realizar su trabajo de construcción, especialmente cuando realice el techado de las casas; lo que le permitirá tener los implementos necesarios para la realización de su trabajo, así seguirá trabajando para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Marcos lives with his wife and two children, who he loves very much. They live in the city of Camana which is known for it's hot climate, beautiful beaches, cultivation of rice and for being a place that you can get deliciously prepared shrimp. In his free time Marcos likes to go fishing because it is relaxing and helps him forget about his problems. Like a good Peruvian, he likes traditional food; his favorite dish is 'Pollo a la Braza' (roasted chicken). Marcos only studied in primary school, which is why he works so hard so that his children will be better than him and have a better future.  

He puts great effort into his work as a master builder. He works close to 12 hours a day, depending on the size and type of construction that he is doing. He believes his business is doing well because he does good work and because his finished products are of good quality and look good, and for these reasons his customers recommend him to others. 

Marcos is very thankful and happy for the help that has been provided by Kiva lenders. Thanks to your support he will be able to buy wood and tools (ropes, hammers, spatulas for plastering walls, as well as other things) that will allow him to do his construction work, especially when constructing roofs for houses. This will allow him to have the tools that are necessary to do his work, and in this way continue to work so that he can realize his greatest dream of helping his children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose tiene 28 años de edad, vive en casa de sus abuelos a los que quiere muchísimo y junto a su esposa y su hijo de dos añitos, viven en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores, así como también por su agricultura. Jose es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, el trabaja como chofer  de mototaxi desde hace dos años, ya que tuvo la oportunidad de comprarse una moto y con ello decidió trabajar en este rubro, su esposa lo apoya en todo lo que el hace y asimismo ella trabaja en el campo y entre ambos aportan con los gastos del hogar. Jose cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y porque se esfuerza mucho por hacer bien su trabajo.

Jose está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá iniciar su negocio de librería, el comprar útiles como cuadernos, lapiceros, hojas bond, entre otros útiles para formar su negocio, lo que le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida, además poder seguir luchando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y tener una cadena de librerías”.
texts.en:
Jose, 28, lives with his wife and son of only two years together in the house of his grandparents whom he loves very much. They live in the city of Imperial, which is characterized by the friendliness of its inhabitants and by its agriculture. Jose is an enthusiastic and hard working young man. He has worked as a motor rickshaw driver for two years. He had the opportunity to purchase one, so he decided to go into this line of work. His wife supports him in everything he does. She also works in the fields. The two of them together contribute to the household expenses. Jose believes that everything is going well with his business because he is very friendly with his customers and because he makes a big effort to do his job well. 

Jose is grateful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to start his bookstore. He is going to purchase supplies such as notebooks, pens, and sheets of paper, among other things he will need to start the business. The business would allow him to earn more income and improve his quality of life. It would also allow him to continue fighting to accomplish his biggest goals of giving his son a profession and opening a chain of bookstores.

loans.use: purchase supplies such as notebooks, pens, paper, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has four children, three of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Kazungu, and he is a businessman which he contributes to the family basic needs. She owns a house that has piped water but no electricity. Food is the family’s highest monthly expense. 

Margaret sells charcoal at wholesale prices. She has done so for five years and her primary customers are restaurant operators. Margaret's other source of income comes from farming. The high cost of transportation is her greatest business challenge. 

Margaret will use a 50,000 KES loan from Yehu to enlarge her selling stall and purchase more sacks of charcoal. She aspires to become a major supplier of charcoal.

loans.use: to enlarge her selling stall and purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Santa Marianita  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Marianita está formado por 11 socias y 1 socio. La señora Ana es parte de este Banco Comunal que se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ella tiene 30 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y 3 años de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio, su marido es comerciante.
 
Ella nos cuenta que los  miembros de este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Para ellos este es su primer ciclo y esperan seguir por mucho tiempo mas ya que se han dado cuenta de la oportunidad que les brinda la institución para poder acceder  a un crédito rápido y con intereses muy bajos.

Doña Ana es una muy buena madre y ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito, para que él lo utilice es su negocio pues él se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado de la ciudad en el cual improvisa un pequeño puesto los cuatro días que vende sus productos, en estos días él madruga al mercado de mayoristas para comprar sus productos los mismos que luego vende al menudeo a las distintas personas que acuden al lugar.  Lleva más de 15 años dedicado a esta actividad y es como ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres para vender a sus clientes.
 	
Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y tener una tienda de víveres en su casa.

La foto pequeña es de una de las socias que por motivos del trabajo no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó ls foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Santa Marianita' is made up of 11 women and 1 man. Ana is a member of this communal bank. They have meetings every two weeks in the parish Pacoaza, which is in the city of Portoviejo. Ana is 30 years old, she is married by civil union, from which she has two children who are 12 and 3 years old. The oldest child studies in junior high. Her husband is a salesman. 
 
She told us that the members of this group are involved in different businesses involving general commerce and offering services. This is the first loan cycle for the group. They hope to continue working together for a long time, because they recognize the opportunity that is offered through the institution to be able to access loans very quickly and with very low interest rates. 

Ana is a very good mother and housewife. She is taking the loan out to be able to help her husband. He will use it for his business, in which he sells fruits and vegetables. He sells in the city market from a small stall, four days a week. On these days he wakes up very early to go to the wholesale market where he buys his products, which he then resells to the people that come to him in the market. He has been doing this for over 15 years, which has allowed him to help his family get ahead. 

This loan will be used to buy fruit and vegetables to sell to his customers. 

Their dreams are to give the very best to their children and to have a small grocery store in their home.  
 	
The small picture is of one of the members who was not able to be there, for other work commitments. the day the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
El grupo estrallitas esta integrado por 9 personas muy trabajadoras y alegres la cuales tienen una actividad economica la cual desarollan para ganar un poco de dinero extra y asi poder dar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida,este grupo se encuentra hubicado en una zona Cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingenio la margarita y su gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña, sus integrantes son: Zacarias venta de abarrotes, epifania venta de refrescos, ines venta de antojitos, ismael venta de dulces, Guadalupe venta de refrescos, Esmeralda venta de ropa, Hilaria venta de ropa, Yolanda venta de antojitos y Vriginia venta de ropa. 

La señora Epifania es uno de los miembros del grupo ella tiene la edad de 59 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y es viuda, ella actualmente vive sola ya que sus hijos ya estan casados, doña epifania nos platica que desde muy pequeña le enseñaron sus padres a trabajar y gracias a esto a saco adelante a su familia, ella actualmente tiene un pequeño deposito de refrescos en su casa con la intencion de ganar un poco de dinero, ella realiza sus ventas con sus amigos y vecinos, ella comenta que como ya tiene muchos años vendiondo ya es conocida en su barrio y Gracias a Dios se vende bien, ella en su negocio siempre tiene musica ya que piensa que eso atrae a sus clientes, doña epifania invertira este credito en la compra de variedad de refrescos para resurtir su nagocio. Doña epifania desea que su negocio continue creciendo y sus ventas aumenten ya que solo asi podra tener una mejor calidad de vida.


Este grupo agradece a la fundacion por la confianza y el apoyo que les han brindado.
texts.en:
The group Estrellitas (little stars) consists of nine people who are very hardworking and happy. They have been developing their businesses in order to earn a little extra money and be able to give their families a better quality of life. This group is located in the Cañera zone, 15 minutes from the La Margarita sugar refinery. The town's residents plant and cultivate sugar cane. The group's members are: Zacarias, who sells groceries; Epifania, who sells soft drinks; Ines who sells snacks; Ismael who sells sweets; Guadalupe who sells soft drinks; Esmeralda who sells clothing; Hilaria who sells clothing; Yolanda, who sells snacks and Virginia who sells clothing.

Epifania is one of the group members and is 59 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school and she is a widow. She currently lives alone because her children are already married. Miss Epifania tells us that since she was little, her parents taught her to work and thanks to this, she has gotten ahead in life with her family. She currently has a small soft drink store in her house and earns some money from it. She sells to her friends and neighbors. She says that now that she has been selling her products for many years and is well known in her neighborhood, thanks to God, she sells a lot. She always has music playing in her business and she believes that this attracts her customers. She will invest this loan in the purchase of a variety of soft drinks to revive her business. She wants to continue growing her business and increasing sales so that she can have a better quality of life. 

This group really appreciates the trust and support that the foundation has given them.

loans.use: purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a 53-year-old woman. She has four children and three are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Bezani and he does farming. Mlongo operates a business of raising goat for meat sale at the market. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are residents. Mlongo's other source of income includes her husband's earnings. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mlongo owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy goats to raise for meat sale for her business. Mlongo aspires to expand her business of selling at a wholesale in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more goats to raise for meat sale for her business.

loans.name: Cherry Fe Joy

texts.en:
Cherry Fe Joy is 24 years old and lives in San Isidro Bajo, Sinacaban. Cherry Fe Joy is married with one child.
 
Cherry Fe Joy has a store that sells a variety of products. Cherry Fe Joy has had this business for two years. Cherry Fe Joy requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.
 
Cherry Fe Joy has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Cherry Fe Joy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Lolita

texts.en:
Ma. Lolita is 62 years old and lives in Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.

Ma. Lolita works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase more fish to sell.

Ma. Lolita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Ma. Lolita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Luzvilla

texts.en:
This is Luzvilla, 50. She is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a driver, and is mother to their children. By the grace of God, Luzvilla has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Luzvilla oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community; the tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 700 Philippines pesos (Php) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Luzvilla dreams to be able to buy another tricycle soon. She also dreams that her children will finish their education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Fifty-four-year-old Victor is a married man with a 23-year-old child. He makes "bahalina" (coconut wine) for a living. Victor also makes vinegar to sell to his community. Victor has a coconut farm, which is the source of his coconut wine and vinegar.

Victor is asking for a loan to invest in his business. He plans to purchase food coloring and containers. This loan will help increase Victor's business profitability. Victor is continuously working hard to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase food coloring and containers.

loans.name: Fifagbe Group

texts.fr: FIFAGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Madeleine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 33 ans et est mariée à un certain Marc. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Madeleine a très peu fréquenté l’école. Madeleine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de six ans, Madeleine vend des chaussures et des ustensiles de cuisine de façon ambulante au Benin. Madeleine  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la cinquième fois que Madeleine et les autres membres du groupe FIFAGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
FIFAGBE is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  

The representative of the group, Madeleine (raising her hand in the photo), is 33 years old and married to a man named Marc.  The couple has three children, all in school and all their dependents.  Madeleine attended school for a very short period of time only.  She lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses along with her husband.

Madeleine has been selling shoes and kitchen utensils, door-to-door, in Benin, for almost six years.  She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.

It is the fifth time that Madeleine and the other members of the FIFAGBE group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' needs.  Their previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and shoes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is married with four children. Joseph is 45 years old and lives in Dansalan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Joseph owns a general store to earn a living; this is his new business. He has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase more stock for his grocery store. Joseph has been a member of PMPC since this year. In the future, Joseph hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his grocery store.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
This is Ismael, 39. He is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Ofelia, a businesswoman, and is the father to their children. By the grace of God, Ismael has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ismael oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. Ismael himself drives their tricycle. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 800 Philippines pesos (Php) every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 16,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Ismael dreams to be able to buy another tricycle soon. He also dreams that his children will finish their education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micrfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Gbetoenomon Group

texts.fr: GBETOENOMON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Akouavi Sylvie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom Ferdinand. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akouavi Sylvie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de treize ans, Akouavi Sylvie vend du riz, de haricot et des condiments dans son quartier. Akouavi Sylvie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la troisième fois que Akouavi Sylvie et les autres membres du groupe GBETOENOMON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les deux crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
GBETOENOMON is a group made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood.

The representative of the group, Akouavi Sylvie (raising her hand in the photo), is 37 years old and married to a mechanic named Ferdinand.  The couple has two children, both in school and their dependents.  Akouavi Sylvie lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various household expenses along with her husband.

She has been selling rice, beans and condiments in her own neighborhood for close to thirteen years. She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

It is the third time that Akouavi Sylvie and the other members of the GBETOENOMON group are requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to strengthen their working capital and their business, and to better meet their customers' needs. Their two previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and beans.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is married. Rufina is 58 years old and lives in Gil, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rufina sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase feed and piglets.

Rufina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

location.town: Liloy-Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Suvdanchimeg

texts.en: Suvdanchimeg is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three kids in Arhangai province, in Central Mongolia. Her husband is a herdsman. Her three kids are at the secondary school. She has been retailing dairy products since 2005. She brings the dairy products from her husband's farm and sells it to the market people in the town. She does trading once or twice a month. She already has a number of regular customers. Suvdanchimeg is a diligent woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by getting two cows for my own business so that I could raise the family income to save money for my kids college fees". The total amount he is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to purchase two cows.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is married with four children. Herminia is 52 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte.

Herminia sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 15,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP to purchase more coconut shell for her charcoal sales business.

Herminia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Herminia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut shells for her charcoal sales business

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is married with two children. Michelle is 30 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Sur.

Michelle owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Michelle has been a member of PMPC since 2012. In the future, Michelle hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Lundee

texts.en: Lundee is a 45-year-old man who lives with his wife and three kids in Uvurhangai province in Central Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. His three kids are in college and the high school. He started a raw material retailing business in 2001. He runs the business depending on the season. In wintertime, he trades animal skins and dairy products like milk, milk products and meats. In springtime, he sells forage for cattle. He has been running the business successfully for these years, improving the household and is responsible for the kid's tuition fees. Lundee is a bright man who says, "I would like to expand the business by getting the supplies in large quantities to sell them in wholesale and raise the income". The total amount he is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to purchase cashmere from Bogd sum.

loans.use: To purchase cashmere goats

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 62 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is married with six adult-age children.

Cecilia has a restaurant business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant business.

Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Cecilia hopes to improve her living conditions

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her restaurant business

loans.name: Handtseren

texts.en: Handtseren is a 55-year-old widowed woman who lives with her daughter and her granddaughter in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter is employed and her granddaughter is in secondary school. She has been running a garment retailing business since 2006. She has made many regular customers and extended the shop counter area in 2009. She has been bringing the goods from Beijing city, China. Now she plans to get the supplies in large quantities to sell at wholesale. Handtseren is a good-natured woman who says, "I would like to expand my business activity by getting more supplies from China so that I could save the transportation expenses and raise the income to improve the household".The total amount she is requesting is 1,200,000 MNT to purchase more garments.

loans.use: To purchase more garments

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married with three children. Lilibeth is 50 years old and lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lilibeth has owned a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Sroeurn

texts.en:
Sroeurn, 45, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

She has been selling fish and pork for more than 10 years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who can earn about USD 7 per day. One of her children is a garment worker and earns approximately USD 3 per day.

Due to the difficulty in family’s transportation, Sroeurn is requesting for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support the family. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide convenient living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sody

texts.en:
Sody, 42, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

She has been involved in agricultural business for more than 20 years and has an extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals. Additionally, she is a primary school teacher. Approximately, she earns USD 5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about USD 3 per day. Two of her children are garment workers. Approximately, they earn USD 7 per day.

Due to the difficulty in family’s transportation, Sody is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to run a tailoring shop for her children and help her children get bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: So Meng

texts.en:
So Meng, 28, is married and resides with her husband and one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been employed in a garment factory for more than five years, earning approximately USD 8 per day.

Meng wants to rebuild her present house to make it bigger in order to provide enough space for her family’s living. With this goal in mind, So Meng is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase construction materials to construct her house. In the future, she would like to run a small pig farm and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to construct her house.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Davaa is a 49-year-old man who lives with his wife and three sons in Uvs province in Western Mongolia. He has been running an animal hide retailing business since 2006. He brings the supplies with his wife from the neighbour provinces and trades them to the local entrepreneurs. He has a further plan to expand the business by getting more supplies to trade in the capital city. With the profits from the business, he has been improving the household such as extending their fence.

Davaa is a diligent man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by getting supplies in large quantities for the new market. I have contracted with the company in the capital city to sell the raw materials."

The total amount he is requesting is 300,000 MNT to purchase more hides.

loans.use: to purchase more hides.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in Bulgan province, in Central Mongolia. 

He has been running a pig farming business with his wife since 2004. He used to work for the flour factory, which had more than 200 pigs. Based on this experience, he has been running the business for eight years. 

He fattens the pigs and, after a year, he sells to the local cafeteria. His wife is responsible for feeding the pigs everyday and sometimes she helps other entrepreneurs to fatten their pigs and is paid for it. 

Ganzorig is a diligent and hardworking man who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing more pigs wholesale, so that my wife and I can improve the family income". 

The total amount he is requesting is 3,900,000 MNT to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is requesting a new loan to pay for his son's driver's licence and a deposit to a taxi company to enable his son to work as a taxi driver. 

Dung's previous loan enabled him to purchase a better motorcycle to work as a moto-taxi driver. This enabled him to work more efficiently and to attract more customers. 

He hopes that another loan will assist his family to increase their income by creating employment for his son as a taxi driver. He hopes that through the loan his son will be able to generate a good level of income and improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for his son's driver's licence and a deposit to a taxi company to enable his son to work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 42 years old and a father of five children, aged between 15 and five years old, all of whom are in school. 

He has been in farming at his rural home in Muranga, Central Kenya for close to thirty years. He runs his farm alone and produces maize, milk, pigs and French beans.

Edwin has requested a loan of 63,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he wants his farm to be producing more than one hundred litres of milk on a daily basis, in order to enable him give his children a better education and improve their food and other basic needs.

Edwin sees an inadequacy of funds and drought as the major challenges to his business. He intends to change is farming habits with the help of Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung would like to take out a further loan to buy more products to sell from her general store. 

Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger variety of different goods for her general store

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. 

This purchase will help her to meet the needs of her customers better. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store increase sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and poultry birds

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang is requesting a new loan to buy a greater stock of beverages to sell from his store. 

His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attract new customers and increase his sales. 

He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to sell from his store

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman. She has a son who is 14 years old. She describes herself to be humble and God fearing. 

She operates a retail store where she sells cereals, such as maize and beans and spices. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located near a bus station and her primary customers are women. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of cereals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more cereals. 

Christine's dream and business goal is to be a distributor of cereals within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals.

loans.name: Xuan Tuan

texts.en:
Tuan would like to take out a further loan to buy some additional new equipment to provide better cleaning services for his customers. 

His previous loan enabled him to earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will attract new customers and through the loan he hopes that he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase better equipment to clean vehicles

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en:
Nhung is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. 

This purchase will help her to meet the needs of her customers better. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increase sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of stock for her general store

loans.name: Mawukpego Group

texts.fr: MAWUKPEGO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Prisca (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un certain Alfred. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Prisca a très peu fréquenté l’école. Prisca vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de sept ans, Prisca vend des chaussures dans un marché du Benin. Prisca s’approvisionne au Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Prisca et les autres membres du groupe MAWUKPEGO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAWUKPEGO Group is made up of three persons, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Prisca, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

She is 31 years old and married to one Alfred. The couple has two school-attending children they have to support. Prisca lives together with her husband and children. They ensure together that the various household expenses are covered.

Prisca didn't attend school for long. For almost seven years, she's been selling shoes in one of Benin's markets. She gets her supplies in Benin.

This is the second time that Prisca and the other members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their working capital and better meet customer demand.

The first loan they obtained was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Akouegnon Group

texts.fr: AKOUEGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Corneille. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Véronique n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Véronique vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de sept ans, Véronique vend du charbon de bois dans dans son quartier. Véronique s’approvisionne dans une région du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Véronique et les autres membres du groupe AKOUEGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
AKOUEGNON Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Véronique, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

She's 29 years old and married to a welder named Corneille. The couple has two children to support, out of whom one attends school.

Véronique lives together with her children and her husband, and the couple ensures together that the various household expenses are covered.

Véronique never attended school. For almost seven years, she's been selling charcoal in her neighborhood. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's regions.

This is the second time that Véronique and the other members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their working capital and businesses, as well as better meet customer demand.

The first loan they obtained was repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 28 años vive (libertad ecuador) . ella comenso su negocio para poder sustentar a sus hijos. Comenso poco a poco y progreso . con esfuerzo y ganas trabaja todos los días por la tarde. Ella a futuro quiere arreglar su casa y progresar con su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara (sillas luces arreglos).
texts.en: Maria is 28 years old. She lives in Libertad, Ecuador . She started her business to be able to support her children. She started little by little and progressed with harf work and dedication. she works every afternoon. In the future, she wants to repair her house and progress in her business. With the loan she will pay for lights and repairs.

loans.use: pay for chairs, repairs and lights.

loans.name: José Eladio

texts.es:
José es un hombre divorciado de 53 años quien vive solo en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del Ecuador, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del país. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. 

José es propietario de un taxi. Empezó este oficio hace diez años y hasta el día de hoy este es su único sustento económico. José necesita pagar la matrícula de su vehículo para de este modo seguir trabajando, para ello ha recurrido a Fundación Alternativa en busca de un préstamo. 

Fundación Alternativa es la institución que gestionará su crédito a través del portal de KIVA. Este es su segundo crédito, y en el primero se destacó por sus pagos puntuales. Esta institución le ha brindado capacitación a José y nos comenta que le pareció muy agradable. De esta manera José podrá tener un crecimiento sustentable y aprovechar al máximo su dinero.

Su sueño es tener su casa propia, y además tener mejores ingresos. Por ahora su necesidad es renovar la matrícula de su vehículo para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
José is a divorced 53 year old man who lives alone in Santo Domingo, one of the youngest cities in Ecuador. Right now it is the junction between the country's sierra and coast. It is a privileged place, not only for its ethnic wealth, but for the landscapes that can be found at the entrance to this beautiful city.

José is the owner of a taxi. He started this job ten years ago and so far this is his only source of income. José  needs to pay to register his vehicle so that he can keep working. To do this, he has gone to the Fundación Alternativa seeking a loan.

Fundación Alternativa is the institution that will manage the loan through the KIVA portal. This is his second loan, and with the first he made his payments on time. This institution has offered trainings to José tells us that he really likes this. In this way, José will be able to have sustainable growth and take the most advantage of his money.

His dream is to own his own house and have better income. For now, he needs to renew the registry for his vehicle to be able to keep working.

loans.use: to register his taxi.

loans.name: Daniel Ruben

texts.es: Daniel de 29 años vive (libertad ecuador)  el con muchas ganas de tener una buena situacio económica empeso a trabajar con la ayuda de su padre. El sale a recorrer todas las mañanas a vender sus verdes. A futuro el desea tener su propio negocio estable . con el préstamo comprara (verdes, legumbres, frutas).
texts.en: Daniel is 29 years old and lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  With a great desire to create a good financial situation for himself, he started working with his father's help.  He goes out every morning to travel around selling his produce.  In the future, he would like to have his own stable business.  He will use his loan to buy greens, vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: to buy bananas, vegetables and greens

loans.name: Gladys Luisa

texts.es:
Galdys tiene 44 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad caracterizada por su clima cálido, sus impresionantes Dunas y por la “laguna de Huacachina”, conocida como el oasis de América”; en esta ciudad vive junto a su hijo de 28 años de edad, al cual ama mucho y quien la acompaña y la apoya en todo. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país por ello su palto favorito es el riquísimo “Pollo al Vino”. Gladys estudio la carrera de industria alimentaria.

Con mucho esfuerzo inicio su negocio de elaboración y venta de vino; se animo a tener este negocio ya que ella estudio la carrera de industria alimentaria;  trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 58 horas diarias y ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque ofrece productos de calidad y muy agradables.

Gladys está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar uva al por mayor para poder elaborar sus productos, con esta mejora ella podrá elaborar mas vino y tener más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar sus ingresos; así ella seguirá luchando cada día para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener una fábrica de elaboración de vinos”.
texts.en:
Gladys is 44 years old and lives in the city of Ica.  This city is noted for its hot climate, its impressive dunes and the 'Huacachina Lake' which is known as the oasis of America.  Gladys lives in this city together with her 28-year-old son who she loves very much and who accompanies her and supports her in everything.  Like all good Peruvians, Gladys really enjoys our country's traditional food.  Her favorite dish is the delicious 'Pollo al Vino' ('Chicken in Wine).  Gladys studied for a degree in food service.

With a lot of effort, Gladys set up her own business making and selling wine.  She wanted to have this business because she studied for a degree in food service.  She works around 58 hours a week in her business and she believes that it is doing well because she sells very nice, good-quality products.

Gladys is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with the help that they give her, she will be able to buy grapes wholesale which will enable her to make her products.  With this improvement, she will be able to make more wine and have more merchandise to offer her customers.  This will allow her to improve her quality of life and her income.  In this way, she will continue working hard every day toward her biggest goal: "to have a wine-making factory".

loans.use: to buy grapes

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is married with two children. Joel is forty-one years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental. Joel used his last loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business grew and become successful. Now he is taking out a new loan to repair a transport vehicle which he uses for his business. 

He is positive and hopes to be able to grow his business even more.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle he uses in his business.

loans.name: Robelinda

texts.en:
Robelinda is from Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is forty-three years old. Robelinda is married and has seven children. To make a living, Robelinda owns and operates a fishing business, buying and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Robelinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2007, Robelinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Robelinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married Kiva borrower. She has five children whose ages range from fifteen to thirty-five. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells home product such as sugar, bread, salt etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more home products to sell. Margaret's dream and  business goal is to expand her retail shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more home products.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is from Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is sixty-nine years old. Ramona is widowed and has ten children. To make a living, Ramona operates a gardening business venture. Ramona has been in her business for thirty-one years and earns 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ramona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramona is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
This is Wilma, forty-two, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Menardo, an electrician, and is a mother to three children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  
                           
Wilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Wilma hopes to expand soon and travel someday, she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
This is Grace, fifty-eight, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Alejandro, a jeepney operator, and is the mother of three children. Together with her husband, shemanages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  
                           
Grace operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Grace hopes to expand soon, she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is sixty-eight years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion runs a business buying and selling footwear and plastic wares in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for twenty years.

In the future Concepcion would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of coffee and herbal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from Centro Napu, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is fifty-three years old. Lorna is married and has two children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a food snack vending business. She has been doing this for six years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase snack items to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase snack items to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Pilar

texts.es: Gloria se 44 años vive (libertad ecuador). Ella decidió hacerse cargo del negocio de ser panadera desde que murió su espozo. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja todos los días sola. A futuro ella desea tener una sycursal que sea reconocida en el centro de santa elena. Con el préstamo comprara (pan lacteos jugos)
texts.en: Gloria is 44 years old and lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  She decided to take charge of the bakery business when her husband died.  She works alone every day with a lot of effort and commitment.  In the future, she would like to have a well-known branch in the center of Santa Elena.  Gloria will use her loan to buy bread, dairy products and juice.

loans.use: to buy bread, dairy products and juice

loans.name: Kerlim Maribel

texts.es: Kerlim de 47 años  vive en (isla Guayaquil) .ella desde muy pequeña aprendió junto a su padre la profesión de ser mecanica. con mucho esfuerzo y ganas decidió desempeñarse ella sola con un ayudante a realizar este trabajo. a futuro ella desea tener su propio local y una casa propia. Con el préstamo comprara(piezas mecanicas )
texts.en: 47-year-old Kerlim lives in Isla de Guayaquil.  Her father taught her to be a mechanic from a very young age.  With a lot of effort and enthusiasm, she decided to carry out this business activity together with an assistant.  In the future, she would like to have her own premises and her own home.  She will use her loan to buy car parts.

loans.use: to buy car parts

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Jehová Es Mi Pastor, está conformado por 13 emprendedores que son de las misma localidad cada uno de ellos tiene sus negocios, todos ellos se apoyan y se brindan consejos unos a otros para sus  negocios que poseen. Estos emprendedores ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, en el crédito otorgado anteriormente fue para aumentar sus productos. Reyna Maria es una emprendedora parte de este grupo, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es al destace de cerdos ya tiene años de experiencia en el negocio sus clientes ya están definido a los cuales les ofrece, la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la compra  cerdos y poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en: 'Jehová Es Mi Pastor' (The Lord is my Shepherd) community bank is made up of 13 entrepreneurs who are from the same town.  Each of them has their own business.  They all support each other and give each other advice regarding their businesses.  These entrepreneurs are existing clients of Fundación León 2000.  They used their previous loan to increase their stock.  Reyna Maria is an entrepreneur who belongs to this group.  Her business is slaughtering pigs and she has years of experience in her business.  She has a well-defined customer base to whom she offers her products.  The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to buy pigs so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Freddy Wilson

texts.es: Freddy de 49 años vive ( duran primavera) ecuador – el se dedica a la profesión de ser peluquero.co muchas ganas el trabaja todos los días para poder solventar a su familia.el trabaja solo hasta la 21:00. A futuro el desea tener otro local que sea grande. Con el préstamo comprara (mas mercadería)como tintes, tigeras, herramientas.
texts.en: Freddy is 49 years old and lives in Primavera de Duran, Ecuador.  His profession is hairdressing.  He works every day with a lot of enthusiasm so that he can provide for his family.  He works alone until 9 o'clock at night.  In the future, he would like to have larger premises.  He will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as dyes, scissors and tools.

loans.use: to buy dyes, scissors and tools

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add on her $600 capital so that she can serve more customers

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut and the Satya Laksana group continue to take out a new loan. They will still need a new loan until they can support their businesses by themselves. Now they are putting savings aside from their profit to use for capital later.

Ni Ketut will use this loan to purchase one sow. Now she has two sows and she has a plan to be a piglet seller. The group have a bigger loan size because they want to increase the population of pigs and the price for feed is quite expensive now.

loans.use: To purchase a sow

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, lives at Batu Ampar-Singaraja, North of Bali. He has one 3-year-old son and his wife is a housewife. Ahmad works as a fisherman. He goes to the sea three times a week. To support his business, he rents a boat. 

Ahmad has a dream to have a boat of his own. To make it come true, he is taking out a loan from MUK. The loan use to purchase a boat for 5M IDR, a boat engine 2,5M IDR and 10 nets @ 450.000 IDR. And he is borrowing 10M IDR. 

Ahmad sells various kinds of fish. Per kg the fish price is 15.000 IDR and Ahmad gets 30 – 50 kg of fish if the weather is good. He hopes he can develop his business because now he has all the equipment by himself.

loans.use: To purchase a boat, engine and nets

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina de 54 años vive ( Quevedo ecuador ) ella empeso su negocio con poca mercadería. Ella decidió seguir este negocio para mejorar su situación económica . con mucho esfuerzo y ganas trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de sus hijos . a futuro ella anhela tener unbuen negocio grande. Con el préstamo comprara ( vitrina )vitrinas, bebidas, enlatados.
texts.en: Agustina is 54 years old and lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  She set up her business with just a little merchandise.  She decided to start this business in order to improve her financial situation.  She works every day with the help of her children and with a lot of effort and enthusiasm.  In the future, she would like to have a large business.  She will use her loan to buy display cases, drinks and canned food.

loans.use: to buy display cases, drinks and canned food

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more helmets to sell

loans.name: Obed Riston

texts.en: Obed Riston, 32, is living in the city of Negara, west Bali. He works selling mobile phone vouchers and this business has already been running for two years. He is asking for a loan of 3M IDR to purchase mobile phone vouchers and also mobile phone accessories. Because now he has more customers, he needs to expand his business inventory. Obed Riston plans to save the profit for his future life. Now he lives alone and all the saving will be used for the preparation of his marriage later on.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone vouchers and mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 70 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Flordeliza has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is 49 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives in Villalin, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Magdalina used her last loan to pay for ingredients and materials to make snacks. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Magdalina is requesting a new loan, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She hopes to be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Rene Manuel

texts.es:
Rene es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, tiene 21 años y vive en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país que son “Las Líneas de Nazca”, son jeroglíficos extensos ubicados en la pampa de Nazca y que según estudios eran una especie de calendario astronómico de loa cultura nazca, asimismo esta ciudad posee un clima cálido en cualquier época del año. Rene disfruta de su tiempo libre escuchando música sobre todo para distraerse un poco de lo agotador de su trabajo, como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica y uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”.

Gracias a ese entusiasmo y dedicación el trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi, el trabaja alrededor de diez horas diarias y puede atender hasta 20 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy optimista y porque pone mucho de su parte por hacer bien su trabajo.

Rene está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo y así tener un vehículo en buen estado para trabajar y ofrecer mayor seguridad a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir trabajando para cumplir su gran sueño:” Fundar una empresa de transporte”.
texts.en: Rene is a hard-working and enthusiastic young man. He is 21 years old and lives in the city of Nazca. This city is noted for the fact that it is home to one of the most important tourist attractions in the country, the 'Nazca Lines'. These are large geoglyphs located in the Nazca desert. According to studies, they were a kind of astronomical calendar for the Nazca people. This city is also noted for the fact that it has a hot climate year round. Rene spends his free time listening to music in order to relax a little from the exhaustion of his work. Like all good Peruvians, he really enjoys our traditional cuisine and one of his favorite dishes is the delicious 'arroz con pollo' (chicken and rice). Rene is a keen and committed worker who works around 10 hours a day in his taxi business and can serve up to 20 customers. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very optimistic and puts a lot of work into doing a good job. Rene is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will be able to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle which means he will have a vehicle which is in a good state of repair. This will allow him to work and offer his customers a safer ride. He will be able to improve his income and continue working in order to achieve his big dream: "To set up a transport company".

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another cart for transporting water to customers.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, age 45, who is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Erlando, a vendor, and is the mother of three children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Erlinda operates a market stall. She sells vegetables and condiment items in the community market. She buys vegetables and other common items used in cooking and sells them per kilo or per piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables and condiments to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda dreams of giving all her children a good and high-quality education and of building her house in her province. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional vegetables and cooking products needed for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
This is Elvira, a 39-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines, a mother of three children, and wife of Sonny, a driver. She and Sonny manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvira sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct-selling brands such as Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing as their income. Elvira's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of 3000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business,Elvira is requesting a Php 11, 000 loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elvira hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving all of her children a good and high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mutai

texts.en:
Mutai has been farming for five years in his rural home in Kitale where he lives with his family of three children aged between seven and two years. His mixed farm produces milk, pineapples and tea which he sells locally to earn income to meet daily family needs.

Mutai has requested a loan of 29,000 KES from Juhudi Kiimo in order to buy a chuff cutter which will improve his dairy animal feeding and significantly reduce costly wastage in feeds. Mutai plans to develop his farm into a zero-grazing system.

Mutai says drought and a lack of finances are farmers' main business challenges, but is glad Juhudi Kilimo is providing loans to small farmers.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sari Pertami Group

texts.en: The Sari Pertami group received their new, larger loan. They need a larger loan because the price for animal feed is quite expensive now. Ni Ketut will use her loan to purchase two sows. Shes plan to be a piglet seller. The cost can be reduced if keeps piglets rather than fattening hogs. She will sell the piglets to another member. The profits from this business are still to be used to continue to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase two sows.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie, from Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, is 33 years old, married, and the mother of two children. To make a living, Analie owns and operates a specialized "sari-sari" variety store selling daily-use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for six years, she earns 3,000 PHP a month.

A member of GDMPC since 2009, Analie is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, to purchase daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 33 and is married with six children aged between 18 and 7. She has been in farming since her teenage years and has been meeting all her family's needs. Her farm produces maize, beans, and vegetables for the local market. 

Everlyne has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the acquisition will boost her family's income and enable her add more cows to her farm. 

She says drought and diseases are the main undoing in farming since production is limited to seasons and much of the income is consumed by regular treatment demands.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 38 years old, married, and has three children. With two children in school, Amy works very hard to provide for them. 

Amy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. 

Amy has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, sugar, spices, noodles, etc. 

In the future Amy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 36 years old, married, and has six children. With five children in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them. 

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell. 

Mercy has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, bread, etc. 

In the future Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
