She works very hard every day by herself.  In future, she'd like to have a house of her own.  She will use the loan to buy rice, oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, snacks, candy and beverages.

loans.name: Karina Rossana

texts.es: Karina de 22 años vive (libertad ecuador) . ella decidió entrar al comercio de ropa para poder mejorara su situación económica. Comenzó vendiéndole a sus amistades. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trabaja todos los días sin ayuda de nadie. A futuro ella anhela tener su familia y una buena casa. Con el préstamo comprara ( camisas, blusas, jeans etc).
texts.en: Karina, 22, lives in Libertad, Ecuador.  She decided to go into clothes sales to improve her economic situation.  She started out selling to her acquaintances.  With much effort and dediation she works every day with no help from anyone.  In future, she'd like to have a family of her own and a good house.  She will use the loan to buy shirts, blouses, jeans, etc.

loans.use: to buy blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Alejandro Nelson

texts.es: Alejandro de 52 años vive (milagro ecuador) el decidió trabajar de conserje en una escuela . al ver que el dinero no le alcanzava para sustentar a su familia decidió vender bollos  le va bien. El trabaja solo todos los días como conserje y los fines de semana como bollero. A futuro el desea tener su familia junta ytener su negocio mejor. Con el préstamo comprara carnes, alquiler de local para picanteria.
texts.en: Alejandro, 52, lives in Milagro, Ecuador.  He decided to work as a caretaker at a school but seeing that the money was insufficient to support his family he decided to sell bollos [green plantain, peanuts and fish wrapped in a banana leaf]; he does well.  He works every day as a caretaker and on weekends as a bollo merchant.  In future, he'd like to have his family all together and to improve his business.  He will use the loan to buy meat and to rent a locale for his snack shop.

loans.use: to buy meat and pay rental on a locale.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela makes and sells clothing to earn an income. She sells her clothes in a lucrative area and has been engaged in this business for two years. She describes herself as ambitious. She is unmarried with no children as yet. 

Pamela's business faces a challenge in that she has insufficient funds for purchasing necessary materials. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more materials for making clothes. She envisions her business expanding to be able to meet her all customers' needs. 

Pamela's primary dream is to secure a stable income in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is taking out an additional Kiva loan in the amount of KES 20,000 to boost her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she intends to purchase bales of clothes to offer for sale. 

The previous loan improved her business and she made additional profits which enabled her meet her family needs.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester, age 50, runs a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She and her husband have three children.

Ester has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 9,000 in order to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale.

In the future, Ester hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda, age 48, runs a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She and her husband have five children.

Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,000 in order to buy stocks for the retail store and also to buy Avon and Natasha products to offer for sale.

In the future, Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the retail store and also to buy Avon and Natasha products to offer for sale

loans.name: Mburucuya Group

texts.es:
El comité Mburucuya es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras y que han visto en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya, una gran oportunidad de progreso para ellas y también para sus familias. Son muy activas y reconocidas en el barrio por su unión y compañerismo.
Petrona es peluquera y nos comenta que se unió al grupo con mucha esperanza de salir adelante y para que por medio del trabajo en conjunto puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras. Ella dice que le va muy bien en el negocio, pues ya tiene una clientela fiel que siempre acude a su local, y que gracias a esto ha podido ir creciendo y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos que necesita para su peluquería, como ser peines, ruleros, spray, gel, tintes y demás insumos. Ella agradece la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The “Mburucuya” committee in the city of San Lorenzo is composed of 17 very hardworking women who recognize in Fundación Paraguaya’s Enterprising Women Program a great opportunity for progress for themselves and their families.  They are very active and recognized in their neighborhood for their unity and companionship.


Petrona is a barber and she comments that she joined the group very much hoping to get ahead and through teamwork be able to help each other out.  She says that she does very well in her business because she has a well-established regular clientele that always comes to her shop and thanks to this she’s been able to grow and improve her living conditions.


She requests the loan to buy supplies she needs for her shop like combs, rollers, spray, gel, coloring and other supplies.  She is grateful for this opportunity she’s getting.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nuevas Amigas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevas Amigas está formado por 7 socias quienes son mujeres trabajadoras y muy luchadoras que a pesar de sus adversidades mantienen su alegría,  laboran día a día en sus diferentes actividades las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue declarada en Diciembre de 1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, cultural y natural. Su gente es de un corazón muy  cálido y mantienen la cultura de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Melva, tiene 38 años, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 17 y 14 años de edad, dos de hijos estudian en el colegio y uno de sus hijos está trabajando y ayuda a la economía del hogar. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora Melva se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 3 años y labora solo días de ferias. En su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como: cerdos, pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de una  vajilla y víveres para continuar con su negocio.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The “Nuevas Amigas” (New Friends) communal bank is composed of seven members who are hardworking, very tenacious women who despite their adversities maintain their cheerfulness.  They work every day in various activities that allow them to cover household expenses.  They live in various parts of the city of Cuenca, a city that was declared a Cultural Heritage of Humanity in December, 1999.  It has great architectural, cultural and natural beauty.  Its residents are very warmhearted and they preserve the cultures of its peoples.

One of the group members is Melva, 38.  She’s married and has three children who are 19, 17, and 14 years of age.  Two of the children attend secondary school and one of them is working and helping out with the home’s economy.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and the house they live in is their property.

Melva has been selling food for the last three years.    She only works on market days.  At home se raises animals like pigs, chickens and guinea pigs that she sells in her community.

This is the first loan she’s had with the communal bank and will use it to buy a set of cooking pots and foodstuffs to continue with her business.  Her dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy a set of cooking pots and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mawuena Group

texts.fr: MAWUENA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Justine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un certain Nestor. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Justine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Justine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de huit ans, Justine vend des condiments dans une ville du Benin. Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin.  C’est la deuxième fois que Justine et les autres membres du groupe MAWUENA sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit reçu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
MAWUENA is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Justine (whose hand is raised in the photo). She is 41 and married to a man named Nestor. They have three dependent children, all in school. Justine never went to school. She lives with her husband and children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Justine has been selling condiments in a city of Benin for nearly eight years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

This is the second time that the group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé to strengthen their working capital and their activity, and to meet the needs of their customers. The first loan was repaid without incident.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale.

loans.name: Dorotea Hermelinda

texts.es:
Dorotea tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos a los cuales ama muchísimo y por los cuales da la vida con tal de verlos felices, junto a ellos vive en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, su agricultura, así como también la generosidad de sus pobladores. Dorotea es una mujer humilde y luchadora, ha trabajado anteriormente en el campo, con mucho sacrificio y ahorro logro tener su negocio de venta de gaseosa y dulces desde hace un año, pero también los fines de semana trabaja haciendo limpieza en una casa de playa, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque Dios siempre está a su lado y la guía para salir adelante, asimismo tiene la mejor motivación que una persona puede tener que son sus hijas.

Dorotea está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar andamios para poder exhibir sus gaseosas ya que actualmente las coloca en el piso, lo que le permitirá mostrar sus productos con mas orden y los clientes se sientas satisfechos, así aumentaran sus ingresos y seguirá trabajando día a día para poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener un restaurante”.
texts.en:
Dorotea, 43, is the mother of four children who she loves very much and for whom she’d give her life to see them happy.  She lives with them in the city of Imperial, a city that is noted for its hot climate, its farming and also for the generosity of its inhabitants.  

Dorotea is a humble, tenacious woman who has worked in the fields in the past.  With sacrifice and saving she was able to acquire her own business selling soft-drinks and candy a year ago but on weekends she also works cleaning a beach house.  She believes that she does well in her business because God is always by her side and guides her forward.  She also has the best motivation any person could have: her daughters.

Dorotea is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given her she will be able to buy shelving to display her soft-drinks since she currently has to display them on the floor.  This will allow her to display her wares in a more orderly fashion and customers will feel satisfied thus her income will increase and she will continue to work day by day to reach her most important dream: “To provide her children with a good education and to have a restaurant.”

loans.use: to buy shelving.

loans.name: Simandokinto Group

texts.fr: SIMANDOKINTO est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Ayaba Jeanne Chantal (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans et est mariée à un certain Idelphonce. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Ayaba Jeanne Chantal n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Ayaba Jeanne Chantal vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a près de neuf ans, Ayaba Jeanne Chantal vend de maïs dans une région du Benin. Ayaba Jeanne Chantal s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la première fois que Ayaba Jeanne Chantal et les autres membres du groupe SIMANDOKINTO sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
SIMANDOKINTO is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Ayaba Jeanne Chantal (whose hand is raised in the photo). She is 43 years old and married to a man named Idelphonce. They have four dependent children, all in school. Ayaba Jeanne Chantal never went to school. She lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Ayaba Jeanne Chantal has been selling corn in a district of Benin for nearly nine years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

Ayaba Jeanne Chantal and the other members of the group SIMANDOKINTO are seeking their first loan from ALIDé to strengthen their working capital, bolster their activities, and meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn for resale.

loans.name: Renan

texts.es: El Sr. Renán tiene 31 años no esta casado pero convive con su pareja con la cual tienen 3 hijos que son 7,3 y 1 años, se dedica a la   agricultura  siembra papa y yuca, su parcela se  encuentra en la localidad de San Pedro, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Renán utilizara este préstamo para  la compra de semillas para  siembra de papa, Renán enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y utilizara los beneficios par mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, el Sr. Renán es una persona muy trabajadora se levanta a tempranas horas  de la mañana para dedicare se a su tierras, se siente feliz y agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Señor Renán is 31 years old.  He is unmarried, but lives with his partner with whom he has three children aged 7, 3, and 1.  He works in agriculture, growing potatoes and yucca.  His parcel of land is located in the San Pedro area.

This loan is his third lending cycle with the financial institution, and Señor Renán will use this loan to purchase seeds for planting potatoes.  Renán faces challenges with his business in moving out of poverty, and will use his profits to improve his family's quality of life.

Señor Renán is a very hard-working person who gets up early in the morning to work his land.  He is happy and appreciative about the opportunity being provided to him.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Isabel Margen

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 27 años de edad, es madre de un pequeño de 1 año de edad y juntos viven en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país que son “Las Líneas de Nazca”, son jeroglíficos extensos ubicados en la pampa de nazca y que según estudios eran una especie de calendario astronómico de la cultura nazca, asimismo esta ciudad posee un clima cálido en cualquier época del año. A Isabel le gusta ver televisión en sus tiempos libres así como también comer uno de sus platillos favoritos que es el riquísimo “Cau Cau”.

Isabel trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, verduras, entre otros al cual le dedica alrededor de 10 horas diarias, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y es constante en su trabajo.

Isabel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora y poder realizar la instalación de energía eléctrica en su vivienda, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida ya que contara con energía eléctrica y poder conservar de mejor manera los productos de su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos, así seguirá trabajando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Isabel, 27, is the mother of a little one-year-old boy; they live together in the city of Nazca, a city noted for having one of the country’s most important tourist attractions: The Nazca Lines, which are extensive hieroglyphics located in the Nazca plains and that according to some studies were a type of astronomic calendar of the Nazca culture.  This city also has hot weather year-round.  Isabel likes watching television in her free time as well as eating one of her favorite dishes which is the very delicious “Cau Cau” [tripe stew].

Isabel works in her business selling groceries, vegetables and others about ten hours daily.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s kind to customers and steadfast at work.

Isabel is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided her she will be able to buy a freezer and to install electricity at home which will allow her to improve her quality of life because by having electricity she will be able to better store the products for her business and improve her income so that she can continue working toward her great dream: “To finish building her house.”

loans.use: to buy a freezer and to install electricity in her house.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 20,000. With the loan, she wants to pay school fees for her children. The previous loan impacted her business and she made additional profits of 50 percent. She dreams of expanding to earn more profits in the future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
This is Lina, 59, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and mother of five children. She, together with her children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lina operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers come up with every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lina hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give all her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ana has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Lurcille

texts.en:
Lurcille is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lurcille is making & peddling viands like "afritada" & "vegetable saute". She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Lurcille has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Lurcille hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia tiene 43  años de edad,  es conviviente  y tiene 3 hijos, Lucia  actualmente es socia en la alcancía comunal “El esfuerzo es grande” grupo  conformado por  9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Lucia  trabaja como vendedora ambulante de dulces desde hace 2 años, Lucia inicia este negocio con el fin de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y que su familia cuente con una mejor calidad de vida,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación   a hecho piso en su casa y cuartos, y sus ingresos se siguen incrementando. Lucia  ha solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos es decir dulces  . Lucia  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran
texts.en: Lucia is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She is currently a member of the 'El esfuerzo es grande' community bank.  This group has nine members who work in different business activities.  Lucia has been working as an itinerant street vendor, selling sweet treats, for two years.  She started this business in order to help her husband with their household expenses so that their family could enjoy a better quality of life.  Thanks to her efforts and commitment, she has managed to lay flooring in her house and build rooms, and her income continues to increase.  Lucia has requested a new loan to buy supplies (sweet treats).  She will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort and loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: to buy sweet treats

loans.name: Jorge Emilio

texts.es:
El solicitantes una persona joven con deseos de superación personal, social y profesional,  tiene un empresa pequeña de cerrajería y construcción de puertas arrollables en el mismo domicilio,  el señor Emilio se mantiene solo e independiente por lo cual es una persona apta para este tipo de crédito. El destino del crédito es para la  refacción de su vivienda, en futuro  el tendrá la oportunidad de implementar mas herramientas a su negocio y de esa manera tener mayores  ingresos, con el crédito podrá llegar a mejorar la calidad de su vivienda y de su negocio  de esa manera  proporcionar un  mejor servicio a las personas que solicitan el trabajo  de puertas arrollable, la ubicación de su negocio y de su domicilio es en el centro de la  ciudad de Santa Cruz que es una zona muy comercial razón por la cual tiene muchos clientes. El solicitante es una persona que tiene mucho esmero y empeño en las funciones que realiza por eso su mercado es  amplio y su competencia está disminuyendo por que los trabajos que el realizan son de muy buena calidad.
Entre sus sueños y metas es crecer más en su pequeña empresa y de esa manera generar empleo.
texts.en:
The person soliciting this loan is a young person with the drive to improve himself personally, socially and professionally. He has a small locksmith shop and builds and sells rolling doors, both businesses he runs from home. Emilio is single and independent, so he’s a good candidate for this loan. The loan he is requesting is to make renovations to his home, and in the future, he’ll be able to add more tools to his business and that way generate more income. With this loan he’ll be able to improve the quality of his home and his business in order to offer a better service to people who are looking for rolling doors. The location of his business and his home is in the centre of Santa Cruz, which is a very commercial area and is the reason why he has lots of clients. The determination and great care Emilio puts into his trade results in good quality work and that is the reason why his competition is dwindling. 
One of his dreams and goals is to grow his small business so he can offer employment.

loans.use: renovate his house and business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman. She has five children between the ages of 2 and 17 and all five are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Kaingu and he works as a businessman. 

Zainabu operates a poultry-keeping business and a car hire business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are neighbours. Zainabu's other source of income includes a tailoring and dressmaking business. She describes her greatest business challenge to be delayed payments by those who purchase on credit and her highest monthly expense is food and rent bills. 

Zainabu rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to repair her car after an accident. Zainabu aspires to become a big farmer and produce more in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to repair her car after an accident.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 40-year-old married lady with three children with ages ranging from 6 to 12. She describes herself as faithful and honest. She has been running  a grocery store for four years now and sells vegetables  such as cabbages, tomatoes, onions, kale, etc. to the local residents in a marketplace. She is faced with a lack of a permanent structure for her business operation. She has  applied for a loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase more vegetables and fruit for her business. She sees her business with more similar outlets in the future. Also, Susan dreams and  hopes to become a major grocery distributor in her area.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables  to sell.

loans.name: Cesenia

texts.en:
Cesenia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with one child. 

Cesenia has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell.

Cesenia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Cesenia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Lédémé (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Léopol. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Lédémé  n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Lédémé vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de cinq ans, Lédémé vend des chaussures et des condiments de façon ambulante au Benin. Lédémé s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la troisième fois que Lédémé et les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DIEU EST GRAND is a group of three people whose members live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is Lédémé (whose hand is raised in the photo). She is 32 years old and married to a mechanic named Léopol. They have three dependent children, all in school. Lédémé never went to school. She lives with her husband and their children, and the couple handle together the various household responsibilities. 

Lédémé has been selling shoes and condiments door-to-door in Benin for nearly five years. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

Lédémé and the other members of the group DIEU EST GRAND are seeking their third loan from ALIDé to strengthen their working capital, bolster their activities, and meet the needs of their customers. All past loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy shoes and condiments for resale.

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
El joven Roberto Carlos reside en un barrio poblado del municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida, desde muy pequeño aprendió a generar sus propios ingresos por lo que desde entonces adquirió experiencia brindando el servicio de tricitaxis donde en ese momento alquilaba este medio de transporte para trasladar a los pobladores de dicho municipio y sus visitantes hacia otros lugares.

Hoy en la actualidad es dueño de cinco tricitaxis los cuales el alquila a diferentes personas para que estos brinden el servicio a los pobladores. Estos los ha adquirido gracias a los diferentes financiamientos que le ha otorgado ceprodel lo que le agradece porque gracias a este negocio lleva el sustento a su hogar.

En estos momentos necesita un crédito para compra de dos tricitaxis mas, ya que actualmente la demanda de la población está creciendo por lo que hay mucha demanda para este servicio, esperando y confiando en Dios que le apoyen con  su solicitud.
texts.en:
Roberto Carlos is a young man who lives in a densely-populated neighborhood in the town of El Sauce.  He has lived here his whole life.  When he was very young he learned to make his own income.  Over the years, he has acquired experience providing a 'tricitaxi' (bicycle taxi) service.  In the past he used to rent a vehicle in order to transport the town's residents and visitors to other places. 

Roberto Carlos now owns five 'tricitaxis' which he hires out to different people so that they can provide this service to local people.  He has acquired his vehicles thanks to a number of loans that he has received from Ceprodel.  He is very grateful because, thanks to his business, he is able to provide for his household.  Right now, he needs a loan to buy two additional 'tricitaxis' because there is a lot of demand for this service.  He hopes and trusts in God that you will support him in his request.

loans.use: to buy two tricitaxis (bicycle taxis)

loans.name: Concesa

texts.en:
This is Concesa, 54, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Lupito, a driver, and mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Concesa oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. Aside from this she also manages a small variety store for additional income. She earns a minimum of Php 500 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Concesa dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle (three wheeled transport vehicle)

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Juanita has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Juanita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Juanita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: MAHOUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Rosine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 26 ans et est mariée à un certain Marius. Le couple a un enfant qui n'est pas encore scolarisé et est à leur charge. Rosine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Rosine vit ensemble avec son enfant et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de cinq ans, Rosine vend des céréales dans une ville du Benin. Rosine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la deuxième fois que Rosine et les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The members of the three-person group MAHOUGNON live in the same neighborhood.  The group’s representative, Rosine (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 26 years old and married to a man named Marius.  The couple has one child who is not yet in school and is in their care.  Rosine did not go to school.  She lives with her husband and child and the couple takes care of the household expenses together.  For nearly five years, Rosine has been selling cereals in a city in Benin.  She gets her supplies in a Benin market.  This is the second time that Rosine and the other members of the MAHOUGNON group have sought financial support from ALIDé in order to build their working capital and their businesses and to better respond to the demands of their clientele.  The previous loan received has been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Sériba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sériba  âgé de 66 ans fait du commerce ambulant depuis  2 ans seulement. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants. Son commerce consiste à vendre des radios, des torches, des portables... C’est grâce aux revenus de cette activité qu’il réussi à nourrir sa famille et à satisfaire leur besoins quotidiens.
Il voudrait investir dans le maraichage avec l’appui des préteurs pour avoir un fond avec lequel il pourra démarrer sans difficulté.
texts.en: Mr. Sériba, age 66, has been an itinerant salesman for only two years.  He is married and the father of six children.  His business consists of selling radios, flashlights, and cell phones.  Thanks to the income from this business, he is able to feed his family and meet their daily needs.  He would like to invest in market gardening with the support of loans to have enough funds to begin without difficulty.

loans.use: to buy flashlights, radios, and cell phones to resell.

loans.name: Luis Adolfo

texts.es: Luis es un joven de 22 años que vive en la casa de su mamá y su padrastro,  a quienes colabora con los gastos del hogar, con la iniciativa de generar ingresos es que Luis inicia su negocio, al principio solo vendía licuadoras y planchas, llevando a diferentes lugares, para vender estos productos de línea blanca tanto al contado como a crédito. A pedido de sus clientes quienes le preguntaban por televisores, DVD y aparatos de sonido es que Luis decide agrandar su negocio, trayendo otros artefactos de mayor precio para satisfacer las necesidades de otros clientes. Luis viaja hasta la ciudad de Oruro para la compra de dichos productos. El destino del crédito es para capital de operación con lo cual incrementará su mercadería y genera más ingresos y de esa manera seguirá colaborando en los gastos de su hogar, ya que también ayuda en los trabajos que desarrolla su padrastro. Luis también  es estudiante de Contaduría y gracias al esfuerzo en sus ventas y negocio es que se puede costear sus estudios en la Universidad. Su meta principal es terminar su carrera para poder tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Luis, 22, lives with his mother and stepfather.  They share household expenses.  Luis started his business because he needed an income.  He sold blenders, irons and other household appliances in the beginning, then branched out to sell other products--televisions, DVD players and other electronics--that his customers asked him to provide.  Luis goes to the city of Oruro to buy the products he sells.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his business.  He wants to expand the range of products he sells so that he can increase his income.  He'll use the extra income to continue paying his share of family expenses and to help his stepfather develop a separate business.  Luis tells us, too, that his business supports his accounting studies.  He wants to finish his degree so that he can shape a prosperous future.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is 33 years old and a single mother of two children whom she looks after all on her own. For three years she has been running a business selling clothes. She got start-up capital from her salary when she was working with British American Tobacco. She faces challenges of seasonal variations and high fuel costs. Her family goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to expand to new markets. Amina needs a loan to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
This is Norma, 44, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnel, an employee, and she is the mother of three children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Norma operates a business, basically buying general merchandise from wholesalers, and selling it at a little profit. Her products are herbal coffee and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of coffee and herbal products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Norma hopes to expand soon, and she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of coffee and herbal products needed in her business

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 34 years old and has three children.She owns a retail shop which she has been running for five years. She started with a restaurant and later went into retail business. She faces challenges of customers who default on payment and her family goal is to educate her children. Margret needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Nogoye

texts.fr: Nogoye fait partie des premières clientes du guichet de l'UIMCEC de sa localité. Elle épargne fréquemment et a déjà obtenu et remboursé intégralement 4 prêts. Le commerce de fruits, de patte d'arachide et d'oseille qu'elle exerce à domicile,lui rapporte des revenus assez consistants.Elle arrive ainsi à prendre en charge ses propres besoins et à s'occuper ds besoins de ses 4 enfants dont elle paie les frais de scolarité. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000f pour acheter des graines et de la patte d'arachide. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un magasin au marché pour vendre ses produits.
texts.en: Nogoye is one of the first account holders at her local UIMCEC.  She frequently sets aside money in savings and has already taken out and fully repaid four loans.  She makes a steady income from the sale of fruits, peanut paste, and dried hibiscus flowers, which she sells from her home.  Because of this she is able to meet her own needs and those of her four children, whose school fees she pays.  To increase her business capital, she is requesting a loan of 100,000F to buy grains and peanut paste.  Her goal is to open a shop in the market to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy grains and peanut paste.

loans.name: Enzo Aroldo

texts.es: Enzo Aroldo habita en casa de su propiedad  junto con sus 4 hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y de caña de azúcar. Este ha sido su negocio desde hace muchos años, y es lo que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. El señor Enzo es un hombre muy trabajador del cual muchas personas dan buenas referencias.  Por medio del cultivo de estos productos es como puede ir subsistiendo él y su familia ya que cada año al sacar la cosecha pone a la venta una parte para sacar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir otras necesidades del hogar. Desea poder  invertir  un poco más en la agricultura con el fin de cosechar una mayor cantidad de granos básicos que le permitan mejorar sus ventas como sus ingresos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (semilla, abonos, venenos para plagas, etc.) para cosechar una mayor cantidad  de granos básicos y lograr el objetivo final de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Enzo Aroldo and his 4 children live in a house that he owns.  He operates a farm where he grows corn and sugar cane.  He has been a farmer for many years and his income from the farm pays for the family's daily bread.  Enzo is a hard-working man and he's earned the respect of his neighbors.  He brings in a crop year after year, then sells part of it to generate enough money to support his family.  He wants to invest a little more in the farm so that he can increase his output and, in turn, his income.  He is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs--seeds, manure, insecticides, etc.--to increase his output.  His only goal is to increase his income so that he can provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Silvia Raquel

texts.es: Silvia Raquel vive  junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Se dedica  al comercio de café molido desde hace varios años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que dado  a la experiencia que posee ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos que cada día la prefieren más por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, honesta y dedicada. Para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con el servicio que reciben. Ofrece calidad de café a los mejores precios, esto ha ayudado a que las personas la prefieran. Ha estado pensando la forma de hacer crecer su negocio y ha llegado a la conclusión que la mejor forma es invirtiendo en el mismo de tal forma que pueda tener la capacidad de cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y calidad  de vida. Esto la hizo tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de café molido al por mayor. Espera y confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta forma logrará su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Tampoco deja de lado el agradecimiento a INTEGRAL ya que esta institución le hecho la mano en el pasado en la inversión de su negocio, de igual forma, en esta ocasión espera obtener una respuesta favorable.
texts.en:
Silvia Raquel lives with her life partner and their children.  She has been selling ground coffee for several years.  She has a lot of customers because her experience has taught her how to win the trust of her neighbors.  Every day they choose her business more and more because she is a hard-working, responsible, honest, and dedicated woman.

The most important thing to her is that her customers are satisfied with the service they get.  She offers quality coffee at the best prices.  This has helped make her business the customers’ preference.  She has been thinking of the way to make her business grow.  She has come to the conclusion that the best way is to invest in the business. That way she will be able to have the capacity to cover a greater demand in the market.  She will do this to improve her income and her quality of life. 

This caused her to make the decision to request this loan with Integral in order to buy ground coffee wholesale.  She hopes and trusts in God Almighty that this way she will achieve her objective of improving her quality of life and that of her family.

She will not overlook her gratitude to Integral because this institution has, in the past, given her a hand in investing in her business.  She hopes to now receive the same, favorable reply to her request.

loans.use: to buy ground coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more home products for selling.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn, 60, is widowed and resides with a daughter in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over ten years, earning approximately US $4 per day. Her daughter is employed in a garment factory. She earns approximately US $3 per day. 

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Soeurn is requesting a loan of US $500 to raise capital in her business for purchasing more groceries to resell. This purchase will enable her to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her presents' house to make it stronger and to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mpasaana Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Aisha is 39 years old and is a hardworking woman. She is the group leader of Mpasaana Tweimukye group, which is made up of nine members. For two years she has been running a produce business, which she started with her own harvests. However, she faces a challenge of seasonal variations and customers not paying on time. She hopes to educate her children and build a more permanent house for her family. Her business goal is to diversify her business and buy land for crop growing. She intends to use this loan to buy produce like maize.

loans.use: to buy produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for computer services.

loans.name: Tweyambe Hakabanda Group

texts.en: Moris is a married man who has four children of school-going age. He runs a carpentry business, which he has operated for a period of 19 years. He started with second-hand clothes, then sold them off and bought timber for his workshop. Moris is a member of Tweyambe Hakabanda, a village group where group each member guarantees the other. The high transport costs affect his business and he looks forward to educating his children. He wants a loan to buy more timber to make furniture for sale.

loans.use: to buy timber to make furniture for sale.

loans.name: César Del Carmen

texts.es:
César del Carmen habita en el municipio de El Sauce, es un joven casado que se desempeña como vigilante para una empresa privada  desde hace varios años.
El objetivo principal por el cual él se acercó a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para mejora de vivienda específicamente para construir una cocina para tener mejores condiciones de vida y así brindarle un techo digno a su esposa.

Es el segundo crédito que solicita este será invertido en la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra. Por lo cual espera siempre el apoyo de tal Institución donde le estará muy agradecido porque gracias a estos financiamientos es que se pueden llevar a cabo los sueños de las personas.
texts.en:
César del Carmen lives in the town of El Sauce.  He has worked as a security guard for a private company for several years.  

Cesar is applying for a Ceprodel loan that he will use to build a kitchen.  He wants to improve his house so that he and his wife have a decent place to live.  

This is Cesar's second loan and he will use it to pay for construction materials--bricks, concrete, sand--and labor.  He is grateful for your support because loans like this one make it possible for people like him to pursue their hopes and dreams.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials and labor.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.

Emma has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She also raises pigs to sell in the future. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab is a 26-year-old single man. He operates a livestock-keeping business and sells his goods from home. Rajab has worked in this business for two years. His primary customers are neighbors. He describes his greatest business challenge as the high cost of transportation and his highest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Rajab will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cows for dairy farming. He aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. Rajab joined Yehu to access capital to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase cows for dairy farming.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, 40, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for over ten years, earning approximately US $3 per day. Her husband works in the public transportation service, carrying garment workers to the factory. He earns approximately US $3 per day. One of Thea's children is also employed in a garment factory and earns about US $3 per day. 

Due to the difficulty in the family’s transportation, Thea is requesting a loan of US $400 to purchase a motorbike to commute. This purchase would enable her to use the saved money on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to build a wooden house and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Madame Ngoné est une femme mariée de 28 ans qui habite au Sénégal. Elle est mère de 2 enfants de 2 et 5 ans respectivement. Elle s’active dans le secteur de la petite restauration depuis plus de 4 ans et vend du petit déjeuner devant chez elle. Parallèlement  elle vend aussi de la glace, de la crème et des jus. Elle a choisi  cette activité pour se procurer des revenus et épauler son mari a supporter les charges familiales. Par conséquent tout ce qui l’intéresse  est la réalisation des bénéfices. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis mai 2010. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un crédit de 50 000 frs prévu pour s’approvisionner en sucre, lait, œufs,  haricots et autres intrants  pour les besoins de son commerce. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui  permettra de  participer dans l’amélioration des conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs.Ngoné is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Senegal.  She is the mother of two children who are two and five years old.  She has been in the small restaurant business for more than four years, and sells breakfasts in front of her house.  She also sells ice cream, cream, and juices.  She chose this business to make money and support her husband in paying the family's expenses, so she is focused on making a profit.  She has been an account holder at UIMCEC since May 2010 and has already repaid a previous loan.  She is requesting a loan of 50,000 francs to buy sugar, milk, eggs, beans, and other ingredients needed for her business.  An increase in profits will allow her to help improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Vedji

texts.fr: Madame Vedji est une femme mariée de 47 ans qui habite dans une des localités de la communauté sénégalaise. Elle est mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 27 ans. Elle évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans et vend des tissus (wax) et  des  draps.  Elle a choisi cette activité dans le souci de gagner des revenus et d’assister son mari dans les charges familiales. Elle est très intéressée par les profits qu’elle réalise. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur et sollicite un financement de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de draps et de tissus wax à revendre. Son objectif est d’augmenter ses bénéfices pour améliorer les conditions de vie sociale  de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Vedji is a 47-year old married woman who lives in a village in Senegal. She has three children between 17 and 27 years of age. She has been a vendor for over 10 years, selling traditional “wax” cloth and linens. She has chosen this type of work with the goal of gaining an income and helping her husband with family expenses. She is very motivated by the revenues she earns. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC branch since November 2003. She has already reimbursed a prior loan and is seeking a loan of 200,000 West African francs for purchasing linen and traditional cloth for resale. Her goal is to increase her income in order to improve the socioeconomic conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth and linens for resale

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza de 30 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con sus 2 hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza y de variedad de joyas. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas del lugar donde habita. Tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y con algunos clientes fijos que dan excelentes recomendaciones de su servicio. Ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, honesta y carismática. Para ella lo más importante es su familia, dado que es la única que trabaja para llevar el pan de cada día  a su hogar. Este negocio es  su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo para seguir dando a su familia lo necesario esperando algún día poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar productos al por mayor como: lociones, cremas, champoo, desodorantes, y variedad de joyas que le permitan atraer a un mayor número de clientes de tal forma que esto le permita aumentar su nivel de ventas así como ingresos que le conduzca a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que así será.
texts.en:
María Esperanza, age 30, lives in her own house with her two children, ages 9 and 13.  The children go to school.  She sells beauty products and a variety of jewelry.  She does this in an itinerant manner in the different zones in the area where she lives.

She has been doing this business activity for several years.  She now has a lot of experience and some fixed clients who give her service excellent recommendations.  She is known for being a hard-working, responsible, honest, and charismatic woman.  Her family is the most important thing to her.  

She is the only one who works to bring home the daily bread.  This business is her main source of income.  Therefore, she wishes to keep it active for a long time in order to continue giving her family the necessities.  She hopes to one day be able to improve their living conditions.

She has made this decision to request this loan from Integral to buy wholesale products like lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, and a variety of jewels.  This will allow her to attract more customers, which will allow her to increase the level of her sales.  The income will lead the way to improving her quality of life and that of her family.  She trusts in God Almighty that it will be so.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, and a variety of jewels.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like air time, phone chargers, a saving machine and many other things.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.

Cecilia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Cecilia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El señor  Juan Bautista es originario del municipio de Achuapa donde ha vivido toda su vida, es un padre de familia responsable que ha preparado a todos sus hijos profesionalmente y que hoy son personas independientes y de bien.
En la actualidad solo tiene a su cargo a su hijo menor y a su esposa con quien trabajan duramente día a día en su negocio el cual consiste en una Pulpería donde ofrecen todo tipo de abarrotería en general, es un negocio bien surtido y visitado por sus clientes por la variedad de productos y por la amabilidad de sus dueños.
Se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, pollo,   verduras y jabón, con el objetivo de surtir más su inventario de productos brindando así un mayor grado de satisfacción a sus clientes, gracias a las utilidades que obtienen de este,  viven dignamente con todas las comodidades en su hogar.
Espera que esta Institución le apoye donde le estará muy agradecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Bautista was born in the town of Achuapa and has lived there all his life.  He is a proud father, one who has worked hard to make sure that his children, all grown but one, were brought up to be what they are now: independent and happy.
Juan operates a corner grocery.  It's a family business and he relies on his wife and son to help him provide the friendly service that his customers want.  Juan is applying to Ceprodel for a loan that he will use to stock his business with the products that his customers want: rice, sugar, cooking oil, soap, etc.  He wants to stock the widest range of products he can so that he can satisfy demand from his custoemrs.  He tells us that he wants the business to be a success so that he can continue providing for his family.
Juan is grateful for your support because loans like this one make it possible for people like him to pursue their hopes and dreams.

loans.use: to stock his general store.

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa Mirian de 54 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está integrado por su esposo de 54 años y sus tres hijos los cuales son mayores de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio de ricas y deliciosas tortillas. Tiene mucho tiempo de de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y la aceptación de muchos clientes. Muchos de sus vecinos  dan buenas referencias de su persona y su servicio y expresan que es una mujer confiable, trabajadora, responsable y dedicada en su trabajo. Todos los días se levanta muy temprano para preparar el maíz con el cual fabrica las ricas tortillas. Le gusta dar un buen servicio a sus clientes de tal forma que siempre estén motivados a regresar. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los insumos necesarios (maíz, gas propano, leña, etc.)  para la fabricación de tortillas, todo esto con el objetivo de cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida y pueda seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa Mirian, age 54, lives in her own house with her family.  Her family is comprised of her 54 year old husband and their three adult children.

She devotes herself to the business of good and delicious tortillas.  She has been involved in this business activity for a long time, she has a lot of experience, and her business is well-received by many customers.  A lot of her neighbors give her good references as a person and for her service.  They say she is a trustworthy, hard-working, and responsible woman who devotes herself to her work.

She gets up very early every day in order to prepare the corn to make the delicious tortillas.  She likes to give her customers good service so that they will always be motivated to return.

She has made the decision to request this loan from Integral to invest in her business by purchasing the supplies (corn, propane gas, firewood, etc.) she needs to make the tortillas.  She will do this in order to cover a greater demand.  This will allow her to improve her living conditions, and she will be able to continue bringing home the daily bread.

loans.use: to buy corn, propane gas, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 28-year-old married man. His wife's name is Vivian and she is self-employed. Peter operates a shoes-selling business and sells his goods in a shop. He has worked in this business for two years. His primary customers are neighbours. 

He describes his greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation and his highest monthly expenses to be food and rent bills. He rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Peter will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase bales of shoes. He aspires to establish another shop to sell shoes in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of shoes.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.en:
Adrian has been in farming for 38 years and produces tobacco, bananas, milk, maize, vegetables, and beans for the local market. He gets additional income from a pension. He is married with five adult children.

Adrian has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. He says the goats will provide milk and make his farming income consistent enough to meet his family’s needs. He plans to increase the number of his goats and cows to twenty and ten respectively within five years.

He notes the inadequacy of water, pests and diseases, and poor market prices as his major challenges.

loans.use: to buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 28 years old, married, and has one child. He has worked as an assistant veterinary doctor in Kagadi town council for a period of one year. Jackson says this is his first work since school. 

He has a dream of educating his children, building a permanent home, and venturing into commercialized farming. Jackson wants a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Eden has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Eden has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 34, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alex, her business partner, and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emma operates a business where she sells watches and cell phones. She buys them at wholesale prices and sells them for a small profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices. Aside from her retail business she also earns an income through her tap water refilling station. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 3,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Emma dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy watches and cell phones for resale

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Madame Ngoné habite dans une des localités du Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 42 ans.  Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 6 et 25 ans. Elle évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans le secteur du commerce. Elle pratique la vente de parfums, de tissus et de produits cosmétiques dans son  propre magasin. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion, et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est la recherche de bénéfices. Elle est membre  du guichet de  l’U-IMCEC de son quartier d’habitation depuis avril 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits cosmétiques et de tissus destinés  à la vente. Son objectif est de renforcer son fond de roulement  a travers ce financement et ainsi  accroitre ses bénéfices en vue de contribuer a l’amélioration de la situation sociale de sa petite famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Ngoné lives in Senegal and is 42 years old.  She is married and the mother of four children between 6 and 25 years old.  She has been in business for more than ten years, and sells perfumes, fabrics, and cosmetic products in her own shop.  She chose the business out of passion, and her main goal is to make a profit.  She has been an account holder at her local UIMCEC since April 2010 and is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy cosmetic products and fabrics to sell.  Her goal is to strengthen her working capital through this loan, and also to increase her profits in order to improve her family's social situation.

loans.use: to buy fabric and cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.es:
Nazira habita en un barrio central del municipio de El Sauce desde hace muchos años. Ella tiene únicamente   una hija a la que le brinda las mejores condiciones de vida, a la que la está preparando profesionalmente.

Es una persona luchadora que trabaja en su propio negocio, es así como obtiene sus ingresos  apoyando  a su esposo con el sustento de su hogar. Su negocio consiste en vender queso, concentrados para animales, ropa, joyas de plata,  tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio este le permite tener a su hija estudiando una carrera universitaria.

Tiene varios años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado seis créditos para capital de trabajo lo que le ha permitido mantener estable su negocio y satisfechos a  sus clientes.
En estos momentos tiene la necesidad de un nuevo crédito para la  Compra de queso, concentrado, blusas, pantalones de mujer y joyas de plata. Para invertir  más en su negocio porque sus clientes le están demandando nuevos productos, esperando y confiando en Dios este apoyo de dicha Institución.
texts.en:
Nazira has lived in a central neighborhood of El Sauce for many years.  She works hard to make sure that her only child, a daughter, gets a good education and has a chance at a better life. 

Nazira makes a living selling a wide range of merchandise: cheese, animal feed, clothing and jewelry, for example.  She has operated the business for several years and her income from the business allows her to pay her daughter's university fees.  

Nazira has been a Ceprodel client for a number of years and she has been approved for six loans before.  The loans have helped her to meet demand from her customers and carry on her business.  She needs a new loan now that she will use to buy cheese, animal feed, blouses, slacks, and jewelry.  Those are the products her customers want and the investment will allow her to provide them.  She is grateful for your support because loans like this one make it possible for people like her to pursue their hopes and dreams.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo. El posee una panadería en el lugar de su residencia donde produce levantándose desde muy temprano, variedad de pan dulce y salado, quesadillas, pastelitos, salpores, pañuelos entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente ya que su producto está elaborado con material de excelente calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, José es un hombre muy trabajador siempre dispuesto a mantenerse adelante de la competencia, piensa que la fortaleza no viene de la capacidad física, sino de una voluntad indomable, el aumento de la demanda en el negocio lo motivo a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor, azúcar, levadura, leche etc. José Antonio tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 40, and lives with his life partner and his son. He owns a bakery located in his home, where from an early hour he produces a variety of sweet and savory bread, quesadillas, small cakes, sugar cookies, pañuelos (pastry turnovers), and other items.

He has gotten a lot of customers lately, because his product is made of excellent quality ingredients and he sells it at affordable prices.

José is a very hard-working man, always ready to stay ahead of the competition. He believes his strength does not come from his physical capacity, but from an indomitable will. 

The increased demand at his business motivated him to apply to Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy flour, sugar, yeast, milk etc. at wholesale. José Antonio hopes that this way he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and milk at wholesale.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Franciscah is aged 38 and has been in farming for five years. She produces and sells cabbages, carrots, and maize in the local markets.

Franciscah has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank, which will help her in harvesting water to meet her cabbage-farming needs. She says she will also use the income to start a retail business.

Franciscah says farmers are challenged by pests, which damage crop yields, and poor rainfall, which limits farm yields.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Grace, 43, is a mother of four children aged 22, twenty, twelve and six years. She has been farming for over ten years, from which she earns her basic source of income for her family. She currently sells her bananas, beans and poultry at the local market.

Grace wants to branch out in her farming and has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She will use the income derived from the cow to educate her children and improve their living standards.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for its loans with monthly repayment schedules. She knows these greatly support smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, ages 8 and 11. She describes herself as an intelligent woman. She has been selling food items such as cereals, kale, cabbages, tomatoes, bananas, oranges, sugarcane, onions, etc. to the general public for the past fifteen years. She faces a financial challenge of inadequate funds for enabling her to expand the general stall she operates. 

Janet is planning to use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cereals, vegetables, and fruits. She dreams and hopes to be a wholesaler in five years.

loans.use: to buy more cereals, fruits, and vegetables.

loans.name: Nessah

texts.en:
Nessah is 27 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. For the past four years she has run a shop near the school where she sells snacks like biscuits, rice cakes, pancakes and orange juice.

Nessah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She is requesting a loan from them for 12,000 PHP to buy more ingredients for making her snacks. Nessah’s ambition is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making her snacks.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman. She has four children between the ages of 3 and 15, all of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Mbele and he works as a carpenter. 

Constance operates a tailoring business and sells her goods in a shop. She has worked in this business for four years. Her primary customers are neighbours and passersby. Constance's other source of income includes selling doughnuts. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses to be food and clothing. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Constance will use the KES 10,000 loan to purchase clothes materials for her tailoring business. 

Constance aspires to purchase a tailoring machine in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital and to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Consulate

texts.en:
Consulate is 26 years old and has two children. She operates a salon business, which she has run for a period of five months now. Consulate got start-up capital from her savings from the salary she earns as a teacher. Inadequate capital and high transport costs are factors affecting the business growth. 

She has a dream of building a permanent home and educating her children. She wishes to expand her business to other new markets and buy land for growing crops. Consulate intends to use the loan to buy cosmetics for the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for the salon.

loans.name: Chhart

texts.en:
Chhart, 42, is married and lives with his wife and four children in Battambang Province, Cambodia. His wife stays at home with the children.

For over six years Chhart has been buying junk materials to sell, earning approximately 7 USD per day. As his present motorbike is broken, Chhart is requesting a loan of 200 USD from KREDIT to pay to repair it. Once repaired, his motorbike would enable him to deliver and sell a greater quantity of junk materials faster.

Chhart’s ambition is to run a small junk shop and help his children get bachelor’s degrees. He would also like to build a new house so as to provide comfortable living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his motorbike repairs.

loans.name: Deobie Lily

texts.en:
Deobie Lily is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. For the past eight years Deobie Lily has run a shop near the school where she sells snacks like biscuits, rice cakes, pancakes and orange juice.

Deobie Lily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan from them for 12,000 PHP to buy more ingredients for making her snacks.

Deobie Lily’s ambition is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for making her snacks.

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana Lidia de 38 años de edad, habita junto a sus hijos y su esposo en casa de su propiedad. Ella es una mujer increíble con muchas ideas de negocio las cuales poco a poco las va poniendo en práctica. Ana se dedica al comercio de variedad de artículos tales como la venta de ropa, calzado, lácteos y de granos básicos que cultiva y luego los pone a la venta. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a estos negocios por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y mucha aceptación de los clientes. Tiene muy buenas referencias de sus vecinos los cuales expresan estar muy satisfechos con el servicio que Ana ofrece. Ha decidido invertir en sus negocios por lo que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir principalmente en la compra de los insumos necesarios (semilla, abonos, venenos para plagas, etc.) para el cultivo de los diferentes granos básicos que ofrece ya que ha notado una demanda creciente en los mismos por lo tanto quiere aprovechar la oportunidad y desea que de esta forma sus ventas se incrementen al igual que sus ingresos para lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ana Lidia is 38 years old and lives together with her children and husband in a house that she owns.  She is an incredible woman who has a lot of business ideas which she is gradually putting into practice.  Ana's business involves selling a variety of products such as clothing, footwear, dairy products and basic grains which she grows and then sells. She has been in these businesses for many years and so she already has a lot of experience and customers.  She has good references from her neighbors who say that they are very satisfied with the service that she offers.  Ana has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business.  She will mainly invest in buying supplies that she needs (seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.) for growing the different basic grains that she sells because she has noticed a growing demand for them and would like to make the most of the opportunity.  She hopes that, in this way, her sales will increase as well as her income so that she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, etc.
