loans.name: Paulino Elías

texts.es: Paulino Elías de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo. El posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende productos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, jabón entre otros, su negocio es muy conocido en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues todo lo que comercia es de excelente calidad a precios accesibles,  además el servicio es único; Paulino es un hombre emprendedor siempre dispuesto a trabajar para poder superarse y triunfar en un futuro, piensa que ganamos la fortaleza, de lo que aprendemos a vencer, él quiere vencer las barreras por eso se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, bebidas, etc. Paulino Elías tiene fe que de esta forma podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Paulino Elías is 40, and lives with his life partner and his son. He owns a store located in his home, where he sells basic household necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, soap, and other items. His store is very well-known in the area, and has gotten a lot of customers, as everything he sells is excellent quality and priced affordably--besides, the service is exceptional. 

Paulino is an enterprising man, always ready to work to improve himself and succeed in the future. He thinks we gain strength from what we learn to overcome. He wants to overcome barriers, and that is why he decided to apply to Integral for a loan that will allow him to buy staple grains, instant products, candy, drinks, etc. Paulino Elías has faith that in this way, he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, instant products, candy and drinks.

loans.name: Hawraa Group

texts.en:
The three women pictured have formed the Hawraa Group and are applying for a 1,500 USD loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. They will split the loan into three portions.

Salwa is a 37-year-old single woman who has worked as a tailor for the past three years. She is a hardworking woman who puts much effort into improving her life both socially and financially. Salwa plans to use her portion to buy special sewing machines necessary to produce quality goods. She would like to open a tailoring factory where she could employ her sister and brother's wife so they could improve their living conditions.

Joumana is a 39-year-old married woman and mother of five children who has worked as a tailor for the past six months. She works hard to help her husband earn a living and add to their income to cover their expenses. She used to farm only, but she decided to work as a tailor to earn more and so improve her family's living conditions. She was an Al Majmoua client for two previous cycles. She used her first loan for her farming and the second to buy her first sewing machine. Now Joumana will use her portion of this loan to pay for her children’s school fees.

Mariam is a hardworking 39-year-old married woman who is the mother of four children. She has farmed for fifteen years. Mariam produces and sells olives, olive oil and tobacco. Most of her clients recommend her products to others because of their good quality. Mariam will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizers and amendments for her land as well as pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and fertilizers and pay school fees.

loans.name: Rosavilla

texts.en:
Rosavilla is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children.
 
Rosavilla has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy stock of clothing to sell.

Rosavilla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, Rosavilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing to sell

loans.name: Einstein

texts.en: Einstein is a 21-year-old young man who describes himself as determined. He has no children yet. He has been selling home products such as bar soap, sodas, cooking fat, eggs, rice, etc., to the general public in a conducive area for the past two years. He faces a business challenge of insufficient funds. He plan to use a loan of KES 20,000 to increase his stock by buying more sugar, cooking fat, eggs, bar soap, and rice. He dreams and hopes to operate a well-established wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more products such as sugar, cooking fat, eggs, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Loyd

texts.en:
Loyd, 37, is a father of three children, two of whom are in school. He has been farming for thirteen years and currently produces bananas, maize, pumpkins and beans. He also trades cooperatively in bananas with bananas from his farm and from other farmers.

Loyd has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo for chickens so as to diversify his farming. He plans to continue diversifying his farm by buying a cow to sell its milk in order to meet his family’s needs adequately.

Loyd says a smallholder farmer’s major challenge remains a lack of adequate finances. He is glad Juhudi Kilimo is helping to mitigate this challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry chicks.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been in farming in his rural home for nine years in addition to engaging in masonry to get enough income to meet the family needs. His farm products, which are mainly coffee and milk, are sold to the local market.

Patrick has made a loan request of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to improve his dairy income with the acquisition of an additional dairy cow. His future plan is to expand both dairy and coffee farms for better income and to make farming his core business.

Patrick says the high costs of feed, fertilizers and pesticides are really hurting to the farmers' efforts. He says he decided to join Juhudi Kilimo after observing the great impact it has had on smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Emily has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Felipe is providing "motorela" or motorcycle services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Felipe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Felipe hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for motorcycle services

loans.name: Elizah

texts.en:
Elizah is a 59-year-old widowed woman. She has four children. 

Elizah operates a food stall business and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for three years. Her primary customers are neighbors and school-going children. She describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality because of school holidays, and her highest monthly expenses are electricity bills and clothing. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. Elizah will use the KES 20,000 loan to repair her food stall, purchase iron sheets and timber, and pay labor. Elizah aspires to establish a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to repair her food stall, purchase iron sheets and timber, and pay labour.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman with four children aged between 17 and 24. She describes herself as a determined woman. She is involved in a dairy farming activity where she sells milk to retailers. In addition, Jane maintains poultry and sells chickens and eggs. She faces a business challenge of high prices of food for the chickens and cows. She plans to use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy a cow to increase the production of milk and hence be able to meet all her customers' needs. Jane's business goal and hope is to be the main supplier of milk in her area. She also plans to own many cows in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 70 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children.
 
Marcela has a shop where she sells green & yellow native bananas. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to buy an additional stock of bananas to sell.

Marcela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marcela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
This is Antonio, 34, a resident of Baseco, Manila, Philippines. He is married to Rosalinda, the mother of his six children. He manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses

Antonio manages his sidecar transportation business. He has one unit of sidecar or bicycle cart that carries up to two passengers to their destination within the community. His regular customers are workers and employees in the community. He also sells biscuits and gas for additional income. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. He will be using the loan for the maintenance of his sidecar. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Antonio hopes to expand his business in the coming years. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance on his sidecar unit

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
This is Editha, 60, a resident of Dasmarinas Cavite, Philippines.   Her husband is Miguel, who is also her business partner.  She is mother to her three children.   She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Editha maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income.  Editha's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Editha is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy merchandise items and orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Editha hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams to buy her own house. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic.  She is 32 years old and is a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ramil, a graphic artist, and is mother to her only child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Marivic operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers and sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. Aside from this, she also retails electronic cell phone loads & offers direct selling products.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Marivic is requesting a Php 45,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marivic dreams to have other branches someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy LPG gas

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 40-year-old man. He is married and a father of seven children. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. His educational background is a Bachelor's degree. His business is in a high traffic area which makes it a main source of income.

Waid started working in a clothing centre in the biggest international market of the city. Two years ago, he bought a small store for selling clothes which has been a profitable project. He already attracted numbers of regular customers and improved the family's income. The business has been successful in the most recent years. Therefore, he is planning to expand the business. 

 So Walid is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy women`s merchandise, such as fabrics, pants, and skirts to stock his business and thus increase his income and have more customers to whom he can offer a wider range of clothes. This investment will enable him to compete with others well and expand his business.

In the future, Walid hopes to have big clothing sales to increase his profit and improve his living conditions as well as buy a car which will facilitate his work.

loans.use: to buy women`s merchandise such as fabrics, pants, and skirts to stock his business.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
This is Mercedita, 42, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Alexander, an employee, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Mercedita oversees operations of their motorcycle rental business. They have three motorcycles that they offer to be rented since public transportation is getting higher. They provide their services within the city. Aside from this, she also earns other income from selling biscuits. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of her motorcycles. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Mercedita hopes to add more motorcycles and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their motorcycles.

loans.name: Tirisia

texts.en: Tirisia is a married woman. She has two children with ages ranging from 5 to 9 years old. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a retail shop where she sells items such as bread, sugar, salt, tea leaves, etc. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a conducive business environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of home products. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more home products. Tirisia's dream and  business goal is to expand her retail shop within five years.

loans.use: To buy more home products to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a farmer in Nkubu area in Central Kenya where her farm produces bananas, maize, beans and milk for the local market. She is married with two children who are 11 and 8 years old and schooling.

Regina has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank. Regina believes adequate water will enable her to earn enough to educate her children and improve their general living standards. She plans to start a cereals retail business with much of the cereals being sourced from her farm.

Regina laments of the high costs of inputs, which limits the farmers’ potential.

loans.use: To buy a water tank

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
This is Nelson, 46, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. Nelson is single manages his household while operating his business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses.  

Nelson operates a piggery. He earns income by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes he has the pigs slaughtered and sold in the market.  Aside from this, he also operates a farm where he gets additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 5000 in sales every week.

To help him continue the operations of his business, Nelson is requesting a PHP 45,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy feeds and additional hogs.  He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Nelson hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy hogs and feed

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has 4 children. 

Myra has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Myra has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Merlyn has a food shop that sells banana-cue, sliced mangoes & fruit juices . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients for making these snacks.

Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Hanah

texts.en: Hanah is a 30-year-old married lady with two children aged one month and three years old. She describes herself as a determined woman. She is involved in a retail store business. She sells items such as sugar, flour, cooking fat, bread, cereals, etc., to  local residents in a conducive business environment. She has been in this business for the past four years and employs one person. She faces a business challenge of inadequate funds for expanding her retail shop. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to restock the retail shop with rice, sugar, flour, and cooking fat. Hanah's dream and business goal is to create more job opportunities for people and be a wholesaler within the next five years.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of rice, sugar, flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Leny has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Leny has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 63 years old, married to Saul, and blessed with three children aged 29, 27 and 23 years. She practices farming, a business she started 20 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 35,000. 

She has requested a loan worth KES 60,000 to purchase farm inputs in preparation for the planting season. The anticipated profit will help her expand her farming business. 

She dreams of being a successful farmer, and this is her third loan.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is a family man aged forty years who supports a family of five. His wife, Caroline, is a businesswoman. Mark has been a livestock trader over the past five years and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Mark is now servicing a fifth loan of 90,000 KES from KADET LTD after repaying his previous loan successfully. He is requesting a 90,000 KES loan that he will use to purchase more goats and sheep to rear and sell later at a profit. This anticipated amount will be used to repay the loan and for his family’s upkeep.

Mark’s ambition is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more goats and sheep.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en:
Mansour is 41 years old, a married man, and he has six children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen.   When he formed his family, he decided to look for an independent activity which would give him enough income to support the welfare of his house. That is how he started his business adventure with working in a store selling scrap. So, with the income, he bought a store and set up an aluminum workshop in a strategic area. 

His business has gradually grown, thanks to his great work capacity, discipline, and responsibility. He is able to attract his customers because he is a professional at making different shapes of windows in aluminum.  Presently he is applying for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy varied items of aluminum which will allow him to expand his business. His investment will be successful because he has a lot of experience.

In the future, Mansour hopes to expand his business to have another aluminum workshop in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy varied items of aluminum which will allow him to expand his business.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Madina has a retail shop.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. 

Madina sells her products retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, bags of rice and maize flour. She also generates additional income through frying samosas and chapattis. The main business challenges for Madina include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler and also to own a delivery van to ease transportation. 

Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt , boxes of soap, bags of rice and maize flour

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en: Sidi is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale. The previous loan enabled her to double her profits which she used to educate her children. She dreams of expanding and establishing another outlet in the future to serve a larger market.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Dania

texts.en:
Dania is a 32-year-old Lebanese divorced woman living with her parents. Her father is the one responsible for covering his family expenses. As for Dania, she has owned a beauty salon since 2009. She works with a high professionalism with the intention to offer the best she can for her clients.  

Today, she’s asking to take out a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added beauty products in addition to a slimming device for her salon. She notes that this will boost her business and allow her to attract new customers. In the future, she plans to enlarge her shop and earn superior income.

loans.use: to purchase added beauty products in addition to a slimming device

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rene Alberto

texts.es: Rene Alberto de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia. El posee una ladrillera muy conocida en la zona, últimamente se hecho de mucha clientela pues lo que comercia es elaborado con material de primera calidad y lo vende a precio realmente accesible, además el servicio es excelente siempre satisface la necesidad del cliente; Rene es una hombre dedicado a su labor dispuesto al cien porciento a superarse y llegar al éxito, piensa  que donde no hay esfuerzo, no hay fortaleza, él se está esforzando por eso le solicito a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar barro, arcilla, arena entre otros. Rene Alberto tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rene Alberto is 50 years old and lives together with his children in his own home. He produces bricks that are very well known in the area. Lately he is making them for many clients since what he sells is made from top quality material and he sells them at a really accessible price. Moreover, the service is excellent and he always satisfies the needs of his clients. Rene is a man who is dedicated to his craft and he is 100 percent prepared to progress and achieve success. He thinks that where there is no effort, there is no strength, he is working hard and for this reason he sought a loan from Integral that will let him buy mud, clay and sand, among other items. Rene Allberto has confidence that this way he will provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase mud, clay and sand

loans.name: Vilma Etelbina

texts.es: Vilma Etelbina de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, pan, frijoles, arroz, leche, huevos, embutidos entre otros, últimamente ha aumentado la demanda pues comercia productos de primera calidad a precios bajos, además el servicio es inigualable; Vilma es una mujer activa siempre pendiente de superarse en su trabajo, le gusta mantenerse adelante de la competencia y nunca fallarle a su clientela, su  más grande secreto para llegar al éxito es la motivación y el, la tiene al cien por ciento es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos productos instantáneos, bebidas etc. Vilma Etelbina tiene la esperanza que de esta forma podrá darle asu familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma Etelbina is 46, and lives with her children. She owns a store where she sells basic household necessities such as bread, beans, rice, milk, eggs, cold cuts, and other items. Lately, demand has increased, as she sells top-quality products at low prices, and besides, the service is unequalled. 

Vilma is an energetic woman, always looking to improve in her work. She likes to stay ahead of the competition and never disappoint her customers. Her greatest secret for success is motivation, and she has it--100%. That is why she decided to apply to Integral for a loan that will allow her to buy staple grains, candy, bread, eggs, instant products, drinks, etc. Vilma Etelbina hopes that in this way, she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy staple grains, candy, bread, eggs, instant products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans and grains, snacks, instant products, cleaning products and seasonings.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Albert and a mother to her five children. She and her husband manage their household while working to earn an income to cover their everyday expenses.

Aida operates a sari-sari. In the Philippines, a sari-sari is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP’s-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Her profits come from buying supplies at wholesale prices, then selling them at retail.

Aida’s store is next to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan from CCT. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income once she does so.

Aida faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members. All CCT community partners are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members that meet on a weekly basis. They gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

Aida dreams of giving her family a good future through her hard work in her sari-sari.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages so as to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a 45-year-old single woman. She has four children between the ages of 9 and 27, and three are enrolled in school. Sophia operates a cereals-selling stall and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are restaurant operators and neighbours.
 
Sophia's other source of income includes selling charcoal, and her highest monthly expenses are rent bills and electricity. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Sophia will use the KES 25,000 loan to purchase sacks of maize, rice, beans, and sugar. Sophia aspires to expand and hire more employees in the future. She joined Yehu because of availability of affordable financial services.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 29 years old, married to Mary and blessed with two children aged six and two years. For the past six years he has sold secondhand clothes and earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES doing so.

Stephen has requested a first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy bales of skirts and blouses. The profit he makes from selling these would help him repay the loan and expand his business.

Stephen’s ambition is to see his business grow and his living standards improve.

loans.use: To buy bales of skirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Elvia Narcisa

texts.es:
Elvia es una mujer de 25 años, se destaca por ser una persona buena, sociable, amigable, responsable en su trabajo y bien sincera. Elvia vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en Salcedo que se encuentra a 10 minutos de Latacunga en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Elvia trabaja sola en la crianza de cerdos blancos, el mismo que es sustento y fuente económica principal para su familia, inició con este negocio por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos en el año 2007. Élvia trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2009 y actualmente solicitó un crédito para la compra de cerdos reproductores para sacar crías e incrementar sus animalitos para criarlos engordarlos y venderlos, proceso que ayudará a incrementar sus ventas e ingresos que serán de gran ayuda para su familia.

Elvia sueña con tener su propia casa y ser distribuidora mayorista de cerdos.
texts.en: Elvia is a 25-year-old woman. She stands out for being a good person, sociable, friendly, responsible in her work and very sincere. Elvia lives with her husband and three children in Salcedo which is found 10 minutes from Latacunga in Cotopaxi Province. Elvia works alone raising white pigs, this same work being the sustenance and financial source for her family. She started in this business out of a need to support her children in 2007. Elvia has worked with Fodemi since 2009 and at present has asked for a loan to buy breeding pigs to produce offspring and increase her number of animals in order to raise them, fatten them up, and sell them. This process will help increase her sales and income which will be a big help to her family. Elvia dreams of owning her own home and being a wholesale distributor of pigs.

loans.use: to buy white breeding pigs to increase the number of animals.

loans.name: Heriberta

texts.es: Heriberta de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su nieta, Ella posee una venta de comida, tortas de  carne y pollo, además de refrescos,  es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las tortas que prepara son exquisitas , hechas con material de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Heriberta es una mujer muy trabajadora se levanta desde muy temprano para empezar a preparar la venta del día, le gusta mantenerse adelante de la competencia, quiere alcanzar muchos sueños y piensa que todo lo que el ser se propone y cree firmemente ello se puede alcanzar, es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima, pan, carne, embutidos, verduras, fruta, etc. Heriberta tiene fe que así podrá realizar sus sueños
texts.en: Heriberta is fifty-four years old and lives with her granddaughter. She has a food stall selling meat and chicken pies, and also soft drinks. She is very well known in her area and she has gotten a lot of customers since the pies she prepares are exquisite; made of top quality ingredients and affordably priced. Furthermore, the service is excellent. Heriberta is a very hardworking woman; she gets up very early to start and prepare the day's sales. She likes to keep herself ahead of the competition. She wants to achieve many of her dreams and she thinks that whatever is proposed and believed in firmly can be achieved. This is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan, which will allow her to buy raw material such as bread, meat, sausages, vegetables, fruit, etc. Heriberta has faith that in this way she will be able to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy bread, meat, sausages, vegetables, and fruit.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel tiene 29 años de edad aún  vive en la casa de sus suegros , vivienda que está ubicada en un barrio de la ciudad de Tarija. Miguel ángel  es casado y tiene un hijo de 5 años a quien cuida y ayuda en su educación junto con su esposa la señora Eva, desde muy pequeño su padre le enseño a trabajar primero como albañil y actualmente realiza trabajos de chapeado y pintado de vehículos. Ahora él tiene que trabajar para poder salir adelante junto con su esposa e hijo. Miguel  desde hace  5 años que trabaja como chapista siendo una persona muy conocida por sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios,  quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero él nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar más herramientas de trabajo,  ya que negocio ha crecido mucho  donde las herramientas que tiene ya no le abastecen. De esa forma poder  realizar los trabajos de manera más rápida y eficiente, por lo tanto  el crédito será destinado para la compra de dichas herramientas de trabajo, de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        Miguel nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por lo tanto entre sus sueños y metas esta construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel, 29, still lives in his in-laws’ house which is located in one of the city of Tarija’s neighborhoods.  Miguel Ángel is married and has a 5 year old son who he cares for and helps to educated alongside his wife, Eva.  Since he was little, his father taught him how to work first as a bricklayer and now he works detailing and painting cars.

He now needs to work in order to get ahead with his wife and son.  For the last five years Miguel has been working as an auto body repairman; he is very well known by his customers who request his services.  He wants to earn better income to get ahead but he tells us that he needs to buy more work tools to do so because his business has grown much and the tools he has are no longer sufficient.  He hopes this way to do the jobs more quickly and efficiently so the loan will be used to buy said work tools to increase his income.  Miguel tells us that he wants to improve his living conditions so among his hopes and goals is to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Demetrio, a golf caddy, and the mother of four children, two of whom are working and two in high school. Together with her husband, she manages their household while working. She works hard to continually provide income for the family’s everyday expenses.

Fe has been buying and selling golf balls for several years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices and then sells them piecemeal outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio, a location that is very accessible to golfers. She also earns additional money from her small variety store from which she earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan from CCT. She will use the loan to buy more quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Fe faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members. All CCT community partners are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members that meet on a weekly basis. They gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quality golf balls to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pablo, tiene 39 años de edad es de una familia humilde y de escasos recursos económicos y por lo tanto cultiva superficies muy pequeñas, vive en la comunidad alejada  del municipio de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y vende sus productos desde hace veinte años, produce papa, frejol y cebolla; los comercializa en la feria de la misma zona   donde vive y  a los comerciantes de la  población de Mizque. El señor Pablo es una persona muy respetado en su comunidad por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la educación  de sus hijos y el bienestar de su familia. El señor Pablo está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas de papa, frejol, cebolla, abono químico, abono orgánico y agroquímicos; y de esta forma aumentar y mejorar la calidad de su producción y por lo tanto tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida toda su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo, 39 years of age, is from a family that is very poor and of scarce economic resources. For that reason, his cultivated fields are quite small and he lives in a community that is very remote from Mizque municipality, Cochabamba department.

Pablo has worked in agriculture and sold his produce for the last 20 years.  He grows potatoes, beans, and onions, and sells them in the public market in the zone where he lives, as well as to merchants of the town of Mizque. Pablo is very respected in his community for his dedication to his work and for his concern for the education of his children and his family's well-being.

Pablo is requesting the present loan to buy more potato, bean, and onion seeds, plus organic fertilizer and agro-chemicals. In this way, he hopes to augment and improve the quality of his harvests and, as a result, generate more income and improve the conditions of life of his entire family.

loans.use: buy seeds, organic fertilizer and chemicals for his vegetable fields.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos,ella vende habas,maiz,moraya y maiz,la socia lo lleva a vender al mercado,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los granos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  granos secos  como maiz,habas,moraya y trigo al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues with her business selling grains; she sells broad beans, corn, dehydrated potato and corn.  She takes it to the market to sell.  She works from 8am until 5pm and through this business is able to support her children.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to be able to sell her grains.  She is asking for the loan to buy dry grains like corn, broad beans, dehydrated potato and wheat at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy dry grains like corn, broad beans, dehydrated potato and wheat at wholesale.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales y verduras,la socia vende tomates,zanahorias,cebollas y pepinos y tambien la socia vende trigo,maiz y cebada,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cereales y verduras.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras y cereales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues with her business selling cereals and vegetables.  She sells tomatoes, carrots, onions and cucumbers and also sells wheat, corn and barley.  She works from 8am until 7pm and through these small businesses is able to support her children.  Her dream is to expand the business of selling cereals and vegetables.  She requests the loan to buy vegetables and cereals at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and cereals at wholesale.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio  y le esta llendo super bien la socia en esta ocasion desea poder implementar su negocio e invertir en su tienda de abarrotes, la socia comprara a l por mayor arroz, azúcar y leche, fideos, la socia también se dedica a la compra y venta de tarwi La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la tienda de abarrotes y comprar arroz, fideos, azucar entre otros.
texts.en: The member continues with her business and it is going extremely well for her. At this time the member wishes to be able to supply her business and invest in her grocery store. The member will buy rice, sugar, milk, and beans wholesale. The member also works buying and selling tarwi (an Andean legume). The member is asking for a loan to stock her grocery store and buy rice, beans, and sugar, among other things.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store and buy rice, beans, and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
This is Pacita, 55, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Vergelio, a security guard, and the mother of four children. Together with her husband, she manages the household while working. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Pacita has been buying and selling golf balls for several years. She buys the balls at wholesale prices and then sells them piecemeal at retail. Her shop is located outside the Philippine Navy golf course in Fort Bonifacio, which is very accessible to all golfers there. She also earns money from her small variety store. Pacita earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan from CCT. She will use the loan to buy more quality golf balls to sell. She knows that having a lot of stock will attract more customers to her store. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

Pacita faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members. All CCT community partners are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members that meet on a weekly basis. They gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

Pacita hopes her business will grow and dreams of being able to give her children a good future and high quality education through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy more quality golf balls to sell.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a thirty-one-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and only one school-aged child who is still attending school. She strives to work really hard to support her husband to provide for their family expenses. He’s a member of the internal national security and has been there for many years. As for Mirna, she has owned a beauty salon since 2009 and she's more than satisfied with what she has attained so far. 

Today, she needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added cosmetic supplies for her shop. This loan will increase her sales therefore her profits thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetic supplies for her shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Raúl Adalberto

texts.es: Raúl Adalberto de treinta y ocho años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia. El posee un taller de estructuras metálicas donde elaboran  puertas, balcones, polines, y cualquier otra que pidan en metal, se ha hecho de mucho clientela últimamente pues su trabajo es de muy buena calidad y ofrece bajos precios, además el servicio es excelente; Raúl es un hombre muy trabajador con muchos sueños por alcanzar quiere ver crecer su negocio y mantenerse adelante de su competencia, su más grande secreto es la perseverancia y el amor a su labor, está dispuesto a llegar al éxito es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar metal por mayor. Raúl Adalberto espera con esta decisión darle una mejor oportunidad de subsistencia a su familia
texts.en:
Raúl Adalberto, 38, lives with his children in his own house.  He has a metal shop where he makes doors, balconies, purlins and anything else made of metal that he’s asked for.  He has attained a large clientele lately because his work is very good quality and his prices are low; besides, service is excellent.

Raúl is a very hardworking man who very much wants his business to grow and to stay ahead of the competition.  His greatest secret is perseverance and love of his work.  He is determined to succeed and this is why he’s asking for a loan from Integral that will allow him to buy metal at wholesale.  Raúl Adalberto hopes that with this decision he will give his family a better opportunity to succeed.

loans.use: to buy metal at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
This is Magdalena, sixty-two, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Pacifico, her business partner, and is the mother of three children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Magdalena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Magdalena dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en:
Elie is a forty-three-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. With the support of his wife, Elie was able to afford a fair way of living for his family. He started to work as a painter in the year 2000 and still works in this area. He works on a free-lance basis and is considered friendly especially with his loyal customers. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his painting tools so he can handle his new projects. This Kiva loan will open a new door for him to take on bigger projects and increase his productivity by 30%. In the future, he plans to open his own painting shop.

loans.use: to renew his painting tools so he can handle his new projects.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with seven children and all children go to school. She also takes care of  additional family members (old parents). She sells from food stall, selling smoked fish, eggplants, oranges and tomatoes. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 6 years and works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of smoked fish, fruits, eggplants, tomatoes and oranges. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to build rental houses and to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and rent.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish, eggplants, tomatoes and oranges.

loans.name: Elipin

texts.en: Elphin is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her cloth-selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials and bed sheets for sale. With the previous loan she was able to increase her monthly profits by 50 percent.  Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth materials and bed sheets for sale.

loans.name: Danilo Fernando

texts.es:
Danilo es un joven de 26 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de nazca, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país que son “Las Líneas de Nazca”, son jeroglíficos extensos ubicados en la pampa de nazca y que según estudios eran una especie de calendario astronómico de loa cultura nazca, asimismo esta ciudad posee un clima cálido en cualquier época del año. Danilo es un joven muy entusiasta en sus tiempo libre le gusta conducir motocicleta y pasear por la ciudad para distraerse, asimismo como buen peruano le gusta muchísimo nuestra comida típica; por ello su plato favorito es el riquísimo “Locro con Carne”. Debiso a los pocos recursos de sus padres el solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar agronomía.

Es un joven responsable y trabajador, se dedica a su labor como chofer de taxi y en algunas oportunidades alquila su vehiculo, trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 8 horas diarias, siempre es atento con los clientes y por ello el cree que le va bien en el negocio, además de que trabaja todos los días con buena aptitud.

Danilo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado el podrá realizar mantenimiento a su vehículo, lo que le permitirá tener en buen estado su vehículo y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio, así seguirá trabajando para salir adelante y cumplir su más grande sueño:” Tener una Flota de vehículos y formar una empresa”.
texts.en:
Danilo is a 26 year old young man. He lives in the city of Nazca, a city known as the home of one of Peru's most important touristic attractions, Las Lineas de Nazca, known in English as the Nazca Lines. The Nazca Lines are extensive hieroglyphics located in the pampa of Nazca. According to studies, they are a type of astronomical calendar used by the Nazca culture. The city itself has a hot climate all year round. Danilo is very enthusiastic. In his free time, he likes to ride motorcycles and walk around the city to entertain himself. Like any good Peruvian, Danilo likes typical Peruvian foods. His favorite dish is the delicious  “Locro con Carne”, a  Peruvian meat stew. Because his parents had limited resources, he only completed his education as far as high school, but he would have liked to have studied agronomy.

Danilo is a responsible and hard working young man. He earns his living as a taxi driver and when the opportunity arises, he rents out his vehicle. He works about 8 hours daily in his business. He is always attentive to his clients and he believes that his business is going well as a result of that attentiveness, and the fact that he works every day of the week and has a good aptitude for what he is doing.

Danilo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to perform maintenance on his vehicle, which in turn will allow him to offer better service. He will continue working in order to move himself ahead and achieve his greatest dream: to have a fleet of vehicles and found a company.

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel Cristina de cuarenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos. Ella posee una tienda en el lugar de su residencia donde vende productos de primera necesidad  frijoles, arroz, jugos, leche, pan entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora siempre dispuesta a buscar oportunidades, quiere un mejor futuro y tiene muchos sueños por cumplir, piensa que hay que perseguir la dicha, y el universo abrirá puertas donde solo había paredes, se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, etc. Isabel Cristina tiene la esperanza determinante que así mejorará las condiciones de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina, 48, lives with her spouse and children.  She has a home-based store where she sells basic staple items like beans, rice, juice, milk and bread, among others.  She has attained a large clientele lately because everything she sells is of the best quality and she sells it at affordable prices; besides, service is excellent.  

Isabel is a very hardworking woman who is always seeking opportunities.   She wants a better future and has many dreams to make reality.  She believes that one must go after happiness and the universe will open doors where there used to be only walls.  

She decided to ask Integral for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy basic grains, snacks, bread, instant products, beverages, etc.  Isabel Cristina has a strong hope that she will improve her family’s living conditions this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosa Milagro

texts.es: Rosa Milagro de cincuenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una pupusería muy conocida en la zona donde reside pues vende las pupusas más exquisitas del lugar revueltas, de queso, frijol entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que prepara es elaborado con material de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles; Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora dispuesta a aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan, tiene muchas metas a futuro, piensa que la propia auto-realización es el mayor servicio que puedes hacerle al mundo, es así como se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permitan comprar maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles, chicharrón, etc. Rosa Milagro tiene la confianza que así como en ocasión anterior solicito a INTEGRAL y ella le impulso a mejorar en su negocio esta vez será mucho mejor aún
texts.en:
Rosa Milagro, 54, lives with her spouse and children in a house of her own.  She has a very well-known "pupusa" [grilled, stuffed corn cake] shop in her neighborhood where she sells the most delicious pupusas in the area.  She sells “revueltas” [stuffed with mixed ingredients], cheese and bean pupusas, among others.  She has attained a large clientele because everything she makes is made with good quality ingredients and her prices are affordable.

Rosa is a very hardworking woman who is ready to take advantage of opportunities that arise.  She has many future goals.  She believes that self-fulfillment is the greatest service one can give the world and this is how she decided to ask Integral for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy corn, rice, cheese, beans, fried pork skin, etc.  Rosa Milagro trusts that just like the last time that she asked from Integral and she pushed to improve her business, this time it will be still better.

loans.use: to buy rice, cheese, beans and pork skin.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew has thirty years of experience in farming and reiterates farming is his family's source of income for their upkeep needs. His farm produces coffee, milk and maize for the local market. He is aged forty-nine and married with four children aged 26, 23,18 and 13.

Andrew has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy water pipes to help in irrigating his farm. He emphasizes irrigation will help increase his production since he will be producing all throughout the year, which was not possible with poor weather conditions. He adds he will use the income majorly to educate his last two children.

He says crop diseases remain an inherent challenge that they must deal with.

loans.use: To buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex has been a farmer in Nkubu area of Central Kenya for twelve years and currently supplies his produce of maize, beans and bananas to the local market. He also runs a timber workshop where he doubles as a carpenter as well. He lives with his family of three children aged between twelve and two. 

Alex has made a loan request of 42,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the income from farming will be ploughed back into his farming business to expand it and make it his core business. He also plans to expand his workshop and relocate it closer to his rural home so he can fully exploit his land which is available in his rural home.

Lack of finances stand in his way. He is glad though for Juhudi Kilimo's services to smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 25,000 to boost her tailoring business. With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials for her sewing business. With the previous loan, she purchased a sewing machine which increased her monthly income by 50 percent. She dreams of owning her own plot in the future. The previous loan changed her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Dagbegnikin 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DAGBEGNIKIN 2 est composé de treize membres qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Philomène, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Philomène est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Philomène est mariée à un certain Marcellin et a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Philomène n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Philomène vend de l’huile de palme à son domicile. Philomène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Philomène et les autres membres du groupe DAGBEGNIKIN 2 sollicitent un crédit deuxième auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: The DAGBEGNIKIN 2 group is composed of thirteen members who reside in the same Benin neighborhood.  The group’s representative, Philomène, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo.  With the goal of building their businesses so as to better respond to customer demand, this group is asking for financial support from ALIDé for the second time.  Philomène is 52 years old and lives in Benin.  She is legally married to Marcellin and has two children.  Both children are their dependents and are in school. The couple takes care of the household expenses together. Philomène didn’t attend school. To provide for the family’s needs, she sells palm oil from her home.  Philomène gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Philomène and the other members of the DAGBEGNIKIN 2 group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé to build their businesses and better satisfy their customers.  Their ambition is to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy cans of palm oil.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata est une  femme mariée de  43 ans, mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre un et 21 ans. Elle vend des  produits  alimentaires  pour enfants tels que bonbons, biscuits, jus, etc,  dans une école de la place non loin de son lieu d’habitation. Auparavant elle pratiquait la vente de poissons. Le commerce constitue pour elle une activité qu’elle a choisie par passion. Et son objectif majeur est la recherche de bénéfices. Elle est membre du guichet de l’institution  depuis octobre 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour le renforcement de son fond  de roulement et  pour l’achat de produits  alimentaires a revendre . Elle souhaite améliorer sa marge bénéficiaire et la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is a 43-year-old married mother of six children aged 1 to 21 years old. She sells children’s snacks such as candies, cookies, juice, etc. in a local school near her home. Prior to this, she used to sell fish. She chose to work in small trade out of passion for this occupation, and her main motivation is the earning potential. 

She became a member of the local U-IMCEC branch in October 2011. She is seeking a loan of 100,000F to strengthen her working capital and to buy merchandise to sell. She hopes to bolster her profits and improve her family’s social standing.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David de treinta y nueve años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, arroz, pan, bebidas, entre otros, es muy conocido en la zona y últimamente se ha hecho de más clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente; David es un hombre muy trabajador  y está dispuesto a cumplir todas sus metas, piensa que si crees en ti mismo y entiendes que hay algo dentro de ti mayor que cualquier obstáculo, solo así se llegara al éxito, es así como le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, bebidas, productos instantáneo, especies, etc. David tiene la confianza que así podrá darle a su familia una mejor oportunidad de vida.
texts.en:
David, 39, lives with his spouse and children.  He has a store where he sells basic staple items like rice, bread and beverages, among others.  He is very well-known in the zone and lately has acquired more customers because everything he sells is good quality and at affordable prices; besides, service is excellent.

David is a very hardworking man who is determined to reach all his goals.  He believes that if you believe in yourself and understand that there is something within you that is greater than any obstacle, you will reach success.  

This is how he’s come to ask Integral for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy basic grains, beverages, instant products, spices, etc.  David is sure that he will be able to give his family a better opportunity in life this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Dancan is aged twenty-four and has been in farming since he was a teenager. In addition to farming, he works as an electrician, doing mainly minor repairs for electrical equipment and installations. His farm currently produces maize and beans for the local market. He is married with child aged four months.

Dancan has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy dairy goats. His future, he says, is in the farming business and he will work hard to increase the number of his dairy goats as well as to get into farming dairy cows once he has become stable in his farming business. He sees good chances for the expansion of his electrical workshop and the improvement of his family's living standards. 

He appreciates that Juhudi Kilimo helps farmers grow in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy dairy goats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 34 tons of fish and use the balance to transport them.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children; two are in school. She has one additional family member (mother). She has a restaurant in the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last six years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, maize flour, beef, cooking oil and serving utensils. Her major business challenges are defaulters, seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to expand into a hotel serving many customers. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gilma De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Gilma de Jesús es originaria de una comarca del municipio de El Sauce ubicada a 8 km de distancia, es una persona luchadora, trabajadora que tiene a cargo a sus tres hijos los cuales todos dependen de ella.
Se dedica al comercio donde su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa y zapatos solo para damas donde tiene mucha experiencia en este ramo y lo que le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar gracias a las utilidades que obtiene de dicho negocio.
El motivo por el cual está solicitando su séptimo crédito en Ceprodel es para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, pantalones, braseares, bikinis y zapatos con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así poder generar más ingresos para  el bienestar de su familia.

Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con esta Institución la cual le ha financiado siempre para capital de trabajo lo que le agradece por tal apoyo como una pequeña comerciante a la que le ha dado estas oportunidades de seguir con su negocio que es el que le permite obtener sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Gilma de Jesús is from an area of the town of El Sauce, located eight kilometers away.  She is a fighter and a hardworking person who is responsible for her three children, all of whom depend on her.

She works as a merchant.  Her business consists of selling clothing and shoes only for women.  She has a lot of experience in this area, which has allowed her to improve her house and bring home the daily bread, thanks to the profits she makes from this business.

The reason she is requesting her seventh loan with CEPRODEL is to invest in buying blouses, pants, bras, bikinis, and shoes, to satisfy her customers' demands and so generate more income for the well-being of her family.

She has been working for four years with this institution, which always has funded her for working capital.  As a small businesswoman who has received these opportunities to continue with her business, she is grateful for this support, which is what allows her to have her own income.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, bras, bikinis, and shoes.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es: Medardo, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su familia. Él se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor, responsable y trabajador. Él se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos y hortalizas desde hace mucho tiempo. Cada año alquila una parcela de tierra para sembrar variedad de granos básicos hortalizas como maíz, frijoles y yuca. Su negocio es cultivar y vender la cosecha. De esta manera es como se gana la vida y lleva el pan de cada día a su hogar. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que su deseo es continuar con su negocio por mucho más tiempo  ya que solo así puede ayudar a su familia a seguir adelante y tratar de dar cada día mejores condiciones de vida. Para él lo más importante es su familia  y es por ella que trabaja día con día desde tempranas horas de la mañana dado que él es el único que recibe ingresos por lo que hace puesto que la esposa se ocupa de las tareas del hogar y en ocasiones ayuda con el negocio. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en los insumos necesarios (semilla, venenos para plagas, abonos, etc.)  para el cultivo de los granos básicos y de la yuca. Además necesita seguir alquilando la parcela de tierra ya que  no cuenta con terreno propio. Tiene mucha confianza que de esta manera logrará su objetivo y le podrá dar a su familia diferentes condiciones de vida  a las que tiene.
texts.en:
Medardo lives in a house of his own with his family.  He is characterized for being an enterprising, responsible and hardworking man.  He has worked farming basic grains and vegetables for a long time.  

Every year he leases a parcel of land to plant a variety of basic grains and vegetables like corn, beans and manioc.  His business is to grow and sell the crop.  This is how he earns his livelihood and brings daily bread to his home.  This business is his main source of income so he hopes to continue with the business for a very long time still since this is the only way he can help his family continue forward and try each day to provide better living conditions.  For him, his family is the most important thing and he works day to day from very early in the morning for them since he’s the only wage earner since his wife does the household chores and sometimes helps him with his business.

He has made the decision to ask Integral for this loan to buy necessary supplies (seeds, bug killers, manure, etc.) for his basic grains and manioc crops.  He also needs to continue leasing the parcel of land since he does not own a parcel of land himself.  He is sure that he will reach his goal this way and will be able to give his family different living conditions than what they currently have.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bug killer, manure, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is fifty-four year old Mohamed. He is married, and has four children aged 30, 21, 12 and 9 years old. He has no additional dependents which live with him. In 1982, Mohamed established his bread baking business. He began his business because he did not go to school as he is a Fulla and his culture believes in doing business rather than getting an education. As a result, when he was ten, he joined his dad, in the bread baking business. When he got married, he established his own bakery.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid the first loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy 20 bags of flour at SLL 220,000 and 100 bundles of wood at SLL 5,000. He will use the balance to transport the items to the bakery. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 1,486,000. In the future, Mohamed plans to have his own employees so that they can help him to produce more so that he can yield more profit. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of flour and 100 bundles of wood and use the balance to transport the items to his bakery.

loans.name: Muhudin

texts.en: Muhudin is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost his existing business. With the loan, he wants to construct rental houses and purchase cement and sand. He dreams of establishing more rental houses in the future. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving him opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: to construct rental houses, purchase cement and sand.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is fifty-two years old, married, and the father of four children. For the last six years, he has run a school in Malindi. He earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his fourth loan, for KES 70,000, to buy additional stationary for his school. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to provide for his family.

His goal for the future is to continue growing his primary school with a view to owning a secondary school later in life.

loans.use: to buy additional stationary for his school.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to help in completing his house. With the loan, he wants to furnish his house, purchase color paints and sand. He dreams of establishing real estate houses in the future.

loans.use: to furnish his house, purchase color paints and sand.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is taking out another Kiva loan to boost her existing business. With the loan, she wants to add to her existing business by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice for resale. She dreams of establishing a grocery shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice for resale.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en: Abdel Rahman is a fifty-year-old Lebanese widowed man living with his two children who are still studying. He’s trying to do the best he can to support them and pay their study fees. He opened his own shoe shop in 2004 where he targets a wide range of clients. Today, he’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the new collection of shoes for his shop. He notes that this loan will certainly push his chance of getting higher returns. In the future, he plans to open other branches.

loans.use: to purchase the new collection of shoes for his shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica has been practicing dairy farming in Eldoret. This is her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. This time she is asking for KES 70,000 which she will use to purchase a dairy cow. 

The anticipated profit will be used to improve her business.  She hopes to be successful in life as well as educate her children. This is her fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tramata

texts.fr: Madame Tramata est une veuve de 59 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Elle est mère d’un enfant et s’active dans le commerce et la vente d’encens. Elle a une expérience de plus de trente ans dans son activité. Elle a choisi cette activité a cause du fait qu’elle est rentable et que   les frais ne sont pas trop chers. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC  de la localité ou elle habite depuis octobre 2011.Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’encens. Son objectif est d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et ses bénéfices afin d’avoir  la capacité de mieux gérer ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en: Mrs. Tramata is a 59 year-old widow who lives in Senegal.  She is the mother of one child and is involved in the business of selling incense.  She has more than 30 years experience in this business.  She chose this business because it is profitable and the expenses are not too high.  She has been a member of the local U-IMCEC branch where she lives since October 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 FRS intended for the purchase of incense.  Her goal is to increase her sales and her profit so that she will be better able to manage her living expenses.

loans.use: to buy incense for resale

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana Gloria de 38 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa por encargo. Tiene 15 años de dedicarse a  este negocio y gracias a sus esfuerzos y dedicación ha logrado mantenerlo activo por todo este tiempo. Ha tenido resultados muy favorables del negocio  ya que ella siempre ha tratado de mantenerse un paso delante de la competencia, manteniendo variedad de prendas de vestir a  los mejores precios. Tiene muy buenas referencias de sus vecinos los cuales expresan estar muy satisfechos con el servicio que presta la señora Ana.
