El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Álvaro, 35 years old, is married and lives with his wife who is his greatest priority. With the loan he hopes to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle. He wants to be able to buy the best parts that are good quality so that his motorcycle doesn't break down in the short run. In this way he can carry out his work more adequately and efficiently. It's the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He has not had previous loans with state banks in the past, but Fudecosur has given him the loan with greater ease and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cereals, wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is married with one child who is in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members .She sells tablecloths door- to –door. She sells her products both at retail and wholesale. She has been in this business for the last seven years .She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy rolls of materials and threads. Her major business challenges are thieves and the rainy season, which hinders her movements. Her goal and aspiration is to get a shop to sell her tablecloths. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of material and thread

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo se considera una persona sociable, alegre, cariñosa, amable, honesto y sobre todo muy trabajador. Segundo vive con su esposa y sus ocho hijos en Salcedo que se encuentra a diez minutos de Latacunga en la provincia de Cotopaxi.

Segundo trabaja con su esposa en la crianza y venta de cerdos, negocio el cual empezó  con un cerdito y mediante ha ido pasando el tiempo ha ido incrementando sus animales. Trabaja con Fodemi desde el año 2009, el actual crédito es para la compra de cerdos para reproducción y balanceado para la alimentación de los mismos, esta inversión permitirá a Segundo seguir en el negocio e incrementar sus ventas, mejorando su calidad de vida.

Segundo sueña con tener criaderos grandes de cerdos y pollos para ser distribuidor mayoritario.
texts.en:
Segundo considers himself a sociable, happy, caring, nice, honest, and above all, hardworking person. He lives with his wife and their eight children in Salcedo, which is located ten minutes from Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi.

Segundo works with his wife raising and selling pigs, a business which he began with one small pig and by means of which he has has increased the number of his animals through time. He has worked with Fodemi since 2009. The current loan is to buy pigs for reproduction and also animal feed with which to feed them. This investment will allow Segundo to continue with his business and increase his sales, improving his quality of life.

Segundo dreams of having large pig and chicken farms in order to be a principal distributor.

loans.use: to buy pigs for reproduction and animal feed with which to feed them.

loans.name: Abdel Kader

texts.en: Abdel Kader is a 48-year-old married man living with his wife and three children. His childrenn are attending school. He has been working in the construction field for the past 13 years and he specializesd in painting. In 2009, he opened his own painting shop. He is the main income provider of his family and always working hard to be able to pay the heavy living expenses, especially his children's school fees. Today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase painting tools and supplies. He is sure that the loan will help him develop his business, which will return a higher income..

loans.use: to purchase painting tools and supplies

loans.name: Ravasco

texts.en: Ravasco is a 44-year-old married man. He has seven children between the ages of 3 and 17 and all are enrolled in school. His wife's name is Dama. Ravasco operates a charcoal business and sells his goods in a shop and from home. He's worked in this business for four years. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Ravasco's other source of income includes firewood selling. He describes his greatest business challenge to be competition and his highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Ravasco will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Ravasco aspires to establish a secondhand clothes selling business in the future. He joined Yehu to access loans to uplift his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 46-year-old married man. He has five children between the ages of 3 and 21, all of whom are enrolled in school. His wife’s name is Anna. Christopher operates a charcoal-selling business and sells his goods at the market. His primary customers are neighbors and passersby. Christopher’s other source of income includes farming. He describes his greatest business challenge as competition, and his highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has electricity but no running water. Christopher will use the 20,000 KES loan to start another business, purchasing cereals of maize, rice, and wheat to sell. Christopher aspires to establish a wholesale shop in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital to boost his business.

loans.use: to start another business, purchasing cereals of maize, rice, and wheat to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two of her children are in school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members .She sells secondhand shoes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years .She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of secondhand shoes. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to start selling secondhand bags and clothes. She lives in her own house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more used shoes

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 24-year-old married man. He has one child. His wife's name is Hadija. Thomas operates a charcoal and sells his goods in a shop. He has worked in this business for one year. His primary customers are his neighbors and passersby. Thomas' other source of income includes a vegetable selling business. He describes his greatest business challenges to be seasonality and competition. His highest monthly expense is food for the family. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Thomas will use the KES 25,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal. Thomas aspires to establish another shop to sell charcoal in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Sonnie

texts.en: Sonnie lives in the Airport Community. She is married with seven children between 10 and 32 years old. For the past 15 years, she has been selling  charcoal in her community. Sonnie says she spends most of her time with her business since her business is in her community. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. Her plan is to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de verduras,ella vende zanahorias,cebollas,tomates,pepinos entre otras verduras,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como cebollas,zanahorias,tomates y pepinos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The partner continues to work selling vegetables.  She sells carrots, onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other vegetables.  She sells from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  With this business she is bringing up her children.  Her dream is to expand her vegetable selling business.  The partner is requesting the loan to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers. The partner is happy about the loan and commits to making her monthly payments.

loans.use: the partner is requesting the loan to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers wholesale.

loans.name: Dagbegnikin 1 Group

texts.fr: DAGBEGNIKIN 1 est un groupement composé de onze personnes, et dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, Rosalie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Rosalie est  mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Epiphane. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Rosalie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Rosalie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Rosalie vend des condiments, des conserves et des poissons fumés dans un marché du Bénin. Rosalie s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Rosalie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement DAGBEGNIKIN 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: "Dagbegnikin 1” is a group composed of 11 individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Rosalie (raising her hand in the photo) is 44 years old. Rosalie is married to Epiphane, a driver. They have three dependent children, all in school. Rosalie lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. Rosalie didn’t go to school. In order to support herself, Rosalie sells condiments, canned food and smoked fish at one of the Benin markets. Rosalie stocks up in Benin. With the goal of expanding her business and becoming more competitive on the market, Rosalie, together with the other members of the “Dagbegnikin 1” group, is seeking her third credit from ALIDé. Their two prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy canned food, condiments and fish.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie lives in Airport, Liberia. She is married, and her husband is a teacher. They have two children, ages 5 and 9, both of whom are currently in school and living at home. For the past 7 years, Julie has been selling used clothes in the market. She enjoys the profit-making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Her future plan is to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Fodé Kandioura

texts.fr: Monsieur  Fodé Kandioura est un jeune homme de 30 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et est maçon de profession. En meme temps il exerce le commerce  et la vente d’ordinateurs, de téléviseurs, de portables et de scooters. Il a une expérience de 5 ans dans son activité qu’il a choisie par amour du business. Il est plutôt attiré  par les retombées financières qui découlent de son activité.  Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’équipement d’une nouvelle salle de jeux qu’il vient d’acquérir. Son objectif est de réussir son opération afin d’augmenter ses revenus réguliers et de pouvoir mieux prendre en charge ses besoins personnels ainsi que ceux de ses proches.
texts.en: Fodé Kandioura is a 30-year-old man who lives in Senegal.  He is married and he is a mason by profession.  At the same time, he also works in retail and sells computers, televisions, mobile phones and scooters.  He has a five-year experience working in this field, which he chose because he loves the business.  He is rather attracted by the profits arising from his activity.  He is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches and is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs, which he will use to equip a new game room that he has just purchased.  His goal is to succeed in this business and get a regular income, which will enable him to better provide for himself and for his relatives.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a game room.

loans.name: Tania María

texts.es:
Tania es una mujer de 38 años, se considera una mujer de caracter estricto, le gusta que las cosas esten bien hechas y es muy responsable en su negocio. Tania vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en Machachi que se encuentra a una hora y media de Latacunga.

Tania tiene una tienda pequeña, en la cual se dedican a atender a los clientes su esposo e hija a demas de Tania. Este negocio empezó hace 5 años y gracias a Fodemi a ido incrementando poco a poco, el crédito que solicita actualmente es para  ampliar la infraestructura de la tienda y comprar más productos para que los clientes tengan mayor variedad. Esta inversión permitirá a Tania obtener más clientela y vender más lo que ocacionará que tenga mayores ingresos y pueda seguir dando el estudio a sus hijos.

Tania sueña en tener un micromercado donde pueda vender de todo y facilitar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Tania is a 38-year-old woman.  She considers herself to be a woman of strict character, who likes things to be done well and is very responsible in her business.  Tania lives with her husband and three children in Machachi, which is located one-and-a-half hours from Latacunga.  

Tania has a small store in which she, her husband and her daughter serve customers.  This business was started 5 years ago, and thanks to Fodemi it has grown little by little.  The loan she is requesting at this time is to expand the infrastructure of the store, and to buy more products so that the customers will have greater variety.  This investment will allow Tania to have more customers and sell more, which will bring her more income so that she can continue supporting her children in their studies.

Tania dreams of having a small market where she can sell all kinds of things and make things easy for her customers.

loans.use: to expand the infrastructure of the store and to buy more products so that the customers can have greater variety.

loans.name: Sittouna.f.z.

texts.fr: Madame Sittouna.F.Z. est mariée et habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 56 ans. Elle pratique l’activité de couture et exerce en meme temps le commerce et la vente de jus locaux, d’eau, de journaux et divers autres produits. Elle capitalise une expérience de 20 ans dans son activité. Elle a choisi cette activité sous l’influence de sa sœur ainée. Ce qui lui plait le plus c’est la beauté des modèles qu’elle crée et surtout les flux financiers qui sont générés par son activité. Elle  est membre du guichet de la localité depuis décembre 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’une nouvelle machine a coudre plus performante qui lui permettra de mieux rentabiliser son activité de couture.
texts.en:
Sittouna F. Z. is married and lives in Senegal.  She is 56 years old.  
She works as a seamstress, but at the same time she is also involved in retail and sells local juices, water, newspapers and various other items.  She has 20 years of experience working in her field, which she chose following the advice of her older sister.  
What she enjoys the most is the beauty of the outfits she creates and the profits generated from her activity.  She has been a member of the local UIMCEC branch since December 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs to buy a new, more efficient sewing machine which will render her sewing business more cost-efficient.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Monte De Bendicion 3, 6, 7 & 8 Group

texts.en:
Luisa is a member of her group "Monte de Bendicion" (Mount of Blessing) 3, 6, 7, & 8. Her group is located in the area surrounding Santo Domingo, one of the poorest areas in the capital, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable.

Luisa is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza. She has been a borrower since two years ago, when she decided to get a loan to reinvest in her clothing sales business. Now she is running a miscellaneous sales business, where she sells more than clothes. For this reason and for her business expansion, she will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and women's accessories. She is using her business profits to reinvest in her business.

Luisa makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their five children. She says that her biggest challenge is working hard for her business. She dreams of having a house built and of living a safe and tranquil life. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and women's accessories.

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es: Carla, tiene 35 años, es casada con 2 hijos uno de 7 y 9 años ambos van a la escuela primaria, su primer negocio fue crianza y venta de cerdo actividad que realizo durante 3 años ya que sus padres son dueños de finca y ella siempre cuidaba y alimentaba los animales. Después de su matrimonio estuvo de ama de casa y actualmente comercializa la venta de leche y productos derivados de la misma también vende gaseosas. En el negocio le apoya su esposo ya que para comprar, vender o entregar la leche tiene que trasladarse en moto, algunos cliente llegan al barrio donde viven en la ciudad de León, cuenta con los ingresos de su esposo es soldador y albañil. La expectativa mas grandes es establecer una pulpería en su casa ya que hay pocas en su barrio y el negocio de la leche es por la mañana y la tarde la tiene libre para atender la pulpería Solicito el préstamo para comprar leche , gaseosas y para  empezar con el negocio de  pulpería.
texts.en: Carla is 35 years old, and is married with 2 children aged 7 and 9 years.  Both of her children attend elementary school.  Carla's first business was raising and selling pigs, an activity that she was involved in for 3 years because her parents were owners of a farm, and she always cared for and fed the animals.  After her marriage she became a housewife, and now she sells milk, dairy products and soft drinks.  Her husband helps her with the business, because in order to buy, sell or deliver the milk she has to transport it by motorcycle.  Some of her customers come to the neighborhood where she lives in the city of Leon.  Carla relies on the income her husband earns as a welder and bricklayer.  Her greatest hope is to someday set up a grocery store in her house, because there are few in her neighborhood, and her milk business is only in the morning, which means that in the afternoons she would have the free time to tend to a grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to buy milk, soft drinks and to start up her grocery store business.

loans.use: to buy milk, soft drinks, and to start up a grocery store business

loans.name: Monte De Bendicion 1 Group

texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the group Monte de Bendicion (Mount of Blessing) 1. This group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. The members are dedicated to doing business around their community and other villages, selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, underwear, and many other products.

Francisca sells used clothes that she buys by the bag. Each bag or packet has around one hundred pieces of good quality second-hand clothes. For Dominicans and Haitians, it is very popular to buy clothes like this. Most of them are good quality and have cheap prices. She sells them from her house and from a flea market. Francisca will use this loan to buy three bags, and with her business profits, she will reinvest in her business by buying more clothing of higher quality, which costs more and requires more capital.

Francisca lives with her husband and their four children. She dreams of having a successful business. She enjoys working at her home and doing business. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy three bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Margina Lissette

texts.es: Margina Asistente Ejecutivo de Negocios, con un futuro brillante, joven que a logrado ir haciendole mejoras a su vivienda, gracias al empleo que Dios le ha permitido tener hasta el dia de hoy; y a los financiamientos otorgados por Kiva y Afodenic, mismos que han sido el puente para que ella y sus padres puedan gozar de una vivienda mas digna, razon por la cual en esta nueva oportunidad su prestamo lo utilizara para dar la continuidad a la puesta de piso de ceramica, en donde hara uso de los siguientes materiales de construccion ceramica, super bond, porcelana, separadores, entre otros y de esta forma empezar el trabajo.
texts.en: Margina, an executive assistant with a bright future, is a young person who has been making improvements to her house, thanks to the work that God has allowed her to have up until now and the loans provided by Kiva and Afodenic.  These loans have been a bridge that has allowed her and her parents to enjoy a more decent home.  The reason for this new loan is to continue to place ceramic tile on the floor of her home.  She will use the loan to buy construction materials including: tile, adhesive, porcelain, separators, and other materials so that she can start the work.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tile for her home

loans.name: Cristo Nos Guia Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Cristo Nos Guía, está conformado por 11 emprendedoras que ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000 en el cual estas emprendedoras expresan que con el apoyo que se les ha brindado han aumentado su mercadería  y tienen nuevos clientes. Estas emprendedoras son luchadoras y con unas de ganas de superación a nivel personal y en cada uno de sus negocios que poseen. Olga Del Carmen es una emprendedora parte de este grupo, su actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de tortilla  ella actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para la comprar productos como maíz, cal leña y otros productos para la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en: The “Cristo Nos Guía” [God Guides Us] communal bank is made up of 11 enterprising women who have previously worked with Fundación León 2000. These entrepreneurs express that with the support it provides them they have increased their merchandise and have new customers. These women are hardworking and have a desire to get ahead, personally and in each of their businesses. Olga Del Carmen is a enterprising woman who is part of the this group. Her business is selling tortillas. She is requesting the loan to buy products such as corn, lime, and firewood, among other products, for making tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, and other products for making tortillas

loans.name: Ory

texts.en: Ory, 50, is married and resides with his wife and six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as construction foreman for over twenty years, earning approximately USD 4 per day. His wife is involved in growing rice and fattening animals. She earns approximately USD 4 per day. Due to the lack of funds, Ory is requesting a loan of USD 700 to pay for his son’s wedding expenses. In the future, he would like to rebuild his present house and help his children get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to pay for his son's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Matilde Lastenia

texts.es: Matilde vive( milagro ecuador ) ella decidió ubicar una tienda en su casa. Y con el pasar del tiempo le fue bien haci que tuvo que incrementar su mercadería. Ahora ella tiene la visión de quererse poner un bazar con la ayuda de su espozo . trabaja todos los días sola de  la 6:00 hasta 7:00. A futuro ella desea tener su casa en buen estado. Con el préstamo comprara ( vitrinas productos etc).
texts.en: Matilde lives in Milagro, Ecuador. She decided to have a store in her house. Over time things have gone well for her and she had to increase her merchandise. She now has the vision of starting a stationary store with the help of her husband. She works every day by herself from 6:00 to 7:00. For the future she wants to have a house that is in good condition. With the loan, she will buy vitrines, products, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, drinks, paper

loans.name: Talosaga

texts.en:
Talosaga is 51 years old and married. She has 10 children, aged 5-23 years old. She owns & operates a business venture, selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members. She has 1 year of experience in this business. Talosaga needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase raw materials to make mats & mattresses. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2012, Talosaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Talosaga's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make mats & mattresses.

loans.name: Malilimago

texts.en:
Malilimago is 20 years old and single. She owns & operates a business venture, selling pork products in the local community. She has 2 years of experience in this business. Malilimago needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Malilimago joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Malilimago's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 60, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rustico, a driver, and mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  
                           
Myrna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Myrna hopes to expand soon and acquire a larger place for her store, she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Tapunuu

texts.en:
Tapunuu is 48 years old and married. She has 6 children. She owns & operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  She has 2 years of experience in this business. Tapunuu needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Tapunuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tapunuu's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 40, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Tyron, a messenger, and a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Mary Jane operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Jane hopes to expand soon, she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
This is Judith, 40, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jessie, a mason, and a mother to her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                       
      
Judith operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Judith hopes to expand soon and dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Vaai

texts.en:
Vaai is 45 years old and married. She has 6 children. She owns & operates a business venture, providing general alteration & tailoring services to local community members. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Vaai needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2009, Vaai joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Vaai's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda, 46, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her two children. She, together with her children, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.              

Melinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Melinda hopes to have another store in their community, she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jader

texts.es: Jader  de 30 años de edad vive en San Juan Nepomuceno, con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años. Allí en esta población tiene un negocio donde vende artículos de la canasta familiar al detalle, dirigido a las familias que están ubicadas a su alrededor. Con su negocio ha logrado el sustento de su hogar  y ha progresado paulatinamente, pues todo no ha sido fácil:   cuando inició lo hizo con capital prestado a un alto costo, poca mercancía y comprando artículos de mayor rotación que muy pronto vendía,   teniendo que pagar rápidamente y casi todas sus ganancias quedaban en manos de particulares. Su cónyuge ha sido su gran  pilar, sin ella  no hubiera podido  lograr desarrollar sus tareas, porque le ha ayudado en este trabajo, mientras simultamentente y de manera estacionaria se dedica también a las tareas de albañilería, mecánica de motos, entre otras, que ha aprendido y con las que ha logrado generar ingresos importantes para crecer. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, que diversificaran su oferta y garantizaran un inventario permanente para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes, quienes muchas veces se van sin lograr su satisfacción, porque Jader no tiene en su tienda y esto es un gran desafío, como también el de no contar el capital de trabajo suficiente, para responderles y con su credikiva lo logrará, razón que potencializa el éxito de esta inversión.
texts.en: Jader is 30 years old. He lives in San Juan Nepomuceno with this wife and his 6-year-old son. In this town he has a business where he sells basic products for the family at retail to the families located in the area. With his business he has been able to provide for his family and he has been making gradual progress. Not everything has been easy. When he started out, he did it with money lent at a high cost, little merchandise, and buying things with high turnover that sold quickly because he had to pay quickly. Almost all of his earnings wound up in other people’s hands. His wife has been his greatest strength. Without her he couldn’t have gotten his work done, because she has helped him in his work, while he simultaneously also works in bricklaying and motorcycle mechanics, among other things that he has learned and which have generated income that have been important for growth. He is now requesting a Kiva loan, his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy grocery items that will diversify his inventory and will guarantee a permanent inventory for responding to his customers’ requests; they often leave dissatisfied because Jader doesn’t have things in his store and this is a big challenge, as is not having sufficient capital. With his Kiva loan he will achieve this, which will improve the success of this investment.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to diversify his inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rubys

texts.es: Rubys  de 35 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad,  en la ciudad de Cartagena. Ella tiene un negocio desde hace 12 años, donde vende frutas y verdura, del cual deriva el sustento de su familia, su negocio está creciendo cada vez más, peor ella está en la búsqueda de organizarse locativamente y aumentar la clientela con sus nuevos vecinos, los que está conquistando, pues ella y su familia recientemente fueron reubicadas por deslizamientos  en Ciudad Bicentenario, macroproyecto de vivienda sostenible gestionado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en su programa “Sueños y oportunidades”. Ella está muy satisfecha  su nuevo habitad, porque está  construyendo su nuevo mercado  y necesita también adecuar su infraestructura locativa,  para ello requiere financiamiento con los que hacer compras y ofrecer sus productos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual  comprará puertas, enchape para áreas húmedas, y cielo Razo para entechar. Con su financiamiento  tendrá un ambiente confortable para su tarea y para el sosiego familiar, lo cual aumenta sus posibilidades de producir aun más y continuar con su sueño de crecimiento empresarial y progreso familiar.
texts.en:
Rubys, 35, lives with her spouse and their six-year-old child in the city of Cartagena.  She has had a business for 12 years, selling fruits and vegetables, from which she derives support for her family.  Her business is growing more every day.  She is looking to set herself up and increase her clientele with her new neighbors, whom she is winning over.  She and her family were recently relocated by landslides in Ciudad Bicentenario, a macroproject of sustainable housing administered by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in its Dreams and Opportunities program.

She is very satisfied with her new dwelling because she is building her new market, and she also needs to make structural renovations.  This is why she requires funding with which to make purchases and offer her products.  This is the reason for coming for a Kiva loan, her first funding from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy doors, veneer for the damp areas, and a ceiling to roof.

With her funding she will have a comfortable environment for her work and for the peace of the family, which will increase her possibilities of producing even more and continuing with her dream of business growth and family progress.

loans.use: to buy doors, veneer for damp areas, and a ceiling to roof.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al trabajo como constructor,el es maestro de construccion donde realiza pintados,construccios y acabados de casas,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es mejorar el trabajo como maestro de construccion.El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas como pinturas,martillo y yeso al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to work in construction.  He is a master builder and does painting, building, and finishing of houses.  Through this work he supports his children.  His dream is to improve his work as a master builder.  The member is requesting the loan to buy tools like paints, a hammer, and plaster at wholesale prices.

The member is happy to receive his loan and is committed to making the payments.

loans.use: to buy tools like paints, a hammer, and plaster at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ganho I Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GANHO I est composé de douze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et se connaissent de par leurs activités. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Cécile est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Cécile n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Cécile est âgée de 56 ans et est mariée à un certain Firmin. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En dehors des trois enfants, le couple a un autre enfant  à leur charge. Cécile et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Cécile vend depuis quinze ans, des plastiques, des chaussures et des tissus de façon secondaire dans sa région. Cécile s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Cécile et les autres membres du groupement GANHO I sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The Ganho I group consists of twelve persons from the same neighborhood who became acquainted through their business activities. The representative for the group, named Cecile, is the person raising her hand in the photo. The group is for the first time seeking funding from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of their business activity and better cope with customer demands.

Cecile has never attended school. She is 56 years old and is married to Firmin. The couple has three children, all in school. Apart from the three children, the couple has another child under their care. Cecile and her husband live with their children and share responsibility for the various family expenditures.

To meet her family's diverse needs over the past fifteen years, Cecile has been selling plastic items, shoes, and to a lesser extent fabrics. She resupplies in one of Benin's markets.

In order to strengthen their business and better serve their customers, Cecile and the other members of the Ganho I group are seeking a first loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase the level of their business activity.

loans.use: Buy plastic items

loans.name: Fatimata Hamady

texts.fr: Madame Fatimata Hamady habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et parent bénéficiaire qui a pendant longtemps fréquenté  le guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité en question. Elle pratique depuis plus de 10 ans le commerce et la vente de tissus teintés. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi pour subvenir aux ses propres besoins ainsi qu’a ceux de sa famille. Elle est membre du guichet depuis juin 2000 et fait partie des membres fondateurs de l’institution. Elle a déjà remboursé 11 crédits antérieurs. Elle sollicite un  prêt de  350 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus teintés a revendre dans le but de mieux développer son activité.
texts.en: Fatimata Hamady lives in Senegal. She is married and a beneficiary who has for a long time associated with the U-IMCEC branch in the town in question. She has been trading and selling dyed fabrics for more than ten years. She chose this activity in order to be able to provide for her own needs as well as those of her family. She has been a member of the branch since June 2010 and is indeed one the institution's founding members. She has already repaid 11 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 350,000 francs so that she can buy dyed fabrics to resell and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabrics for resale

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye  habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et âgé de 39 ans. Il est employé dans le programme de développement  de l’enfant et de la famille de la localité ou se situe le guichet de l’U-IMCEC ou il est membre. Parallèlement  il évolue dans le secteur du commerce et la vente de téléphones  portables et accessoires depuis 10 ans. Il a choisi cette activité de commerce pour arrondir les fins de mois. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les revenus  qui sont générés. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis avril 2003. Il a déjà remboursé 6 prêts  antérieurs . Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour la finition du carrelage d’une partie de la maison familiale. Ce financement lui permettra d ‘améliorer le cadre de vie familiale.
texts.en: Abdoulaye lives in Senegal. He is married and 39 years old. He is employed in the child and family development program in his town where the U-IMCEC branch of which he is a member is located. At the same time he has been developing a business selling portable telephones and accessories for the past ten years. He chose this activity in order to make ends meet towards the end of the month. He is mostly interest in the income which the business generates. He has been a shareholder member of one of the U-IMCEC branches since April 2003 and has already repaid six previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs so that he can finish the tiling of part of the family house. This loan will allow him to improve his family's living environment.

loans.use: to finish the tiling in his house

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa est une femme âgé(e) de 37 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et a 01 enfant de 08ans scolarisé.
Yawa travaille comme revendeuse d’ignames frites (communément appelé au TOGO koliko) depuis 2009. Elle vend avec 01 personne au bord de la route de la route et s’approvisionne à Lomé. Son souci est la rupture des matières premières.
Yawa a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames, de l’huile végétale, des spaguettis. Elle veut assurer l’éducation de son enfant  avec le profit réalisé.
texts.en: Yawa is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a retail merchant and has one eight-year-old child attending school. Since 2009, Yawa has been working as a retailer of fried yams (commonly referred to as koliko in Togo). She sells along the roadside, helped by one assistant, and resupplies in Lomé. Her concern is the breakage of raw materials. Yawa is requesting her first loan from WAGES to buy yams, vegetable oil, and spaghetti. She wants to use her profits to ensure the education of her child.

loans.use: Buy yams, vegetable oil and spaghetti

loans.name: Luafulu

texts.en:
Luafulu is 41 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a business venture selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  She has 4 years of experience in this business.

Luafulu needs a loan of $2,000 WST to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2009, Luafulu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Luafulu's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell at her store

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
This is Emelia, 54, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Emelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHPs worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emelia hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Javkhlantugs

texts.en:
Mr. Javkhlantugs is 34 years old and lives with his mother and daughter (3) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2006. His wife works and lives in Korea and she makes phone calls to her family occasionally.

Javkhlantugs has a plan to have a small taxi company within a decade. Now he owns one car for his business, but he wanted another one for rental by another driver. Otherwise, he is going to hire another driver for support with his business.

It is important to his business that he is expanding and increasing the business earnings as he believes his monthly earnings will be increased notably providing that he has two cars for his business. Now he needs a loan to cover the cost of purchasing one more car for his taxi business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing one more car for his taxi business

loans.name: Emelith

texts.es: Emelith de 42 años, vive  en el municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno, con su cónyuge y tienen 3 hijos en las edades de 15 a 22 años. Con su negocio de vender víveres y comidas, ha logrado generar ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su hogar. Cuando Emelith inició su vida comercial, lo hizo con un pequeño expendio de carne que surtió con víveres en un pequeño kiosco, posteriormente lo amplió y hoy vende junto con su esposo, pasteles de masa y de arroz, jugos naturales hechos con frutas tropicales y víveres. El éxito de su trabajo es que produce con su esposo persistentemente para lograr el buen desempeño de su unidad familiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará gaseosas, huevos, castillería, desechables, leche y cerdo. Emileth y su esposo conocen muy bien su negocio, especialmente los productos de mayor rotación y aquí radica que esta inversión se convierta en todo un éxito, para el cumplimiento de su desafío de adecuar su local, darle estudios a sus hijos y todo esto lo logrará ampliando su capital de trabajo, empezando con este credikiva en proceso.
texts.en: Emelith, 42, lives in San Juan Nepomuceno with her partner and their 3 children, 15-22 years.  Her business is selling food supplies, and prepared food and she has succeeded in generating income to support the wellbeing of her family.  When Emelith started her commercial life, she began with a small meat outlet that she supplied with food supplies in a small kiosk.  Later on she enlarged it, and today, along with her husband, she sells meat pasteles (filled corn and rice pastries), natural juices made with tropical fruit, and food products.  The  success of her business with her husband is that they continually work as a family.  Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she has had with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy soft drinks, eggs, meat, paper goods, milk, and pork.  Emileth and her husband know their business very well, especially the products that move the fastest, and there is how their investment will become a success.  Her goal is to fix up her stand, and give her children their schooling. All this will happen by increasing her working capital, beginning with the incoming Kiva loan..

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, meat, paper goods, milk, and pork

loans.name: Arledis

texts.es: Arledis de 42 años, vive con su esposo y tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 24 años, a quienes desea apoyarlos en su bienestar tanto como ella pueda. Por eso tiene un negocio, con el cual genera ingresos , mediante el que vende perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, el que inició desde hace un año,  con poco capital, pero en la medida en que fue ganando clientela, fue creciendo y agregó otros proveedores que le facilitaron catálogos, o guías especializadas mediante las cuales aun promociona y vende sus productos. En su negocio vende a crédito, mediante pedidos y una parte también la vende de contado; últimamente sus ventas han aumentado y por eso compró una máquina de coser para elaborar ropa a sus clientes, por eso sus  clientes han aumentado pues ha pasado de sus amigas y vecinas a clientes referidos por estos y tener el su capital de trabajo suficiente para satisfacerlos  se vuele un desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, pues quiere hacer crecer sus dos negocios, por eso planea con este financiamiento,  comprar  2 vitrinas, materias primas, como telas hilos e insumos como aplicaciones y mercancías variadas como perfumes y maquillajes con los que surtirá su vitrina. Su plan es organizar su infraestructura gradualmente y dotarla te todas, las herramientas, equipos y enseres que se requieren para el buen funcionamiento de sus negocios.
texts.en:
Forty-two year old Arledís lives with her husband and has four children, ages 12 to 24 years, whose wellbeing she wants to support as much as she can. This is why she has a business, with which she can earn income by selling perfume, creams, cosmetics. She opened it a year ago with very little capital, but in the interim she has gained many customers, continued to expand it, and gotten together other providers who give her catalogues or specialized directories, through which she can promote and sell her products. 

She sells on credit based on orders and sometimes by payment on delivery; Lately her sales have increased, and because of this she bought a sewing machine to make clothing for her customers.  That's why her customers have increased in number, since she has gotten recommendations from friends and neighbors, and having the necessary startup capital to satisfy them is a challenge. 

This is the reason why she is asking for a Kiva loan, since she wants to expand her two businesses. That is why she is planning on getting this loan—she wants to buy two display cases, raw materials like needles and thread, goods like appliques and varied merchandise, like perfumes and makeup, all of which she will put in her display cases. Her plan is to organize an infrastructure over time and to give it her all. The tools, machines, and equipment are necessary for the proper functioning of her businesses.

loans.use: to buy two display cases, raw materials like needles and thread, and goods like appliques, and varied merchandise, like perfume and makeup.

loans.name: Yoram

texts.en:
Yoram is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife, Yuliana, 35 years old, and three children: Rifal, who is 15 years old and attending senior high school, grade 1; Gresly, who is 10 years old and attending elementary school, grade 5; and Karan, who is 8 years old and attending elementary school, grade 3.

Yoram is a farmer who rents a plot of land to be planted with rice. He learned farming skills from his parents. Every day he goes to the field on foot. The field is located approximately 2,000 meters from his house. His wife accompanies and helps him when he works in the field.
 
Yoram has to generate income on a regular basis to meet his family needs, but harvests of the rice paddy happened only once every three months, so he plants vegetables, such as “kangkung” and basil on another plot. He harvests the vegetables every month and sells them at a traditional market. The income from selling vegetables helps him meet his family needs and pay his children’s school fee. He desires to save part of his income for his children’s future.

Yoram plans to plant more vegetables. He is sure that the more seeds he plants then the more income he can earn. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,000,000 from TLM. He would like to purchase vegetable seeds, disinfectant, and rice seedlings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds, disinfectant and rice seedlings.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Harlince

texts.en:
Harlince is a 37-year-old woman who is married to Martinus, a 42-year-old man. They have been blessed with a daughter, Mikha, who is 2 years old. 

Harlince and her husband adopted three children into their family. They are Miati, 13 years old, who is attending junior high school, grade 1; Febi, 11 years old, who is attending elementary school, grade 4; and Adibu, 5 years old.

Harlince initiated a pig breeding business in 2007. She usually raises the pig for seven to eight months before selling it. The selling price is around 3,500,000 IDR per pig, depending on the weight. The income from the business enables her to support the needs of her family as her husband’s income as a mason is insufficient to meet their needs.

Harlince has four pigs to raise and one of them is ready to be sold. She desires to purchase more piglets to raise, so she applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000. She hopes that the loan will help her to be success in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 25 años, es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y responsable. Ana vive con su esposo e hijo en Latacunga provincia de Cotopaxi.

Ana trabaja en la crianza y venta de cerdos, se dedica a este negocio porque vió rentabilidad y necesita sustentar gastos de su hogar y mantener a su hijo. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de balanceado para la alimentación de los cerdos para que se engorden y poder venderlos.

Ana sueña con mejorar su calidad de vida y poer obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ana is a 25 year old woman. She is a very happy, hardworking, responsible person. Ana lives with her husband and son in Latacunga, Province of Cotopaxi.

Ana works in the raising and selling of pigs. She does this job because she sees it as profitable and needs to pay for household expenses and support her son. This is her first loan that she is asking for from Fodemi, and she will use is for the purchase of a feed mill for her pigs to feed them so they get fatter so she can sell them. 

Ana dreams of improving her standard of living and being able to make more money.

loans.use: to purchase feed mill for the feeding of her hogs.

loans.name: Karel

texts.en:
Karel is a 52-year-old married man. He has three children: Yufita, 26 years old and married; Angelus, 22 years old and studying at private university; Ne’a, 12 years old and studying at the first grade of junior high school.

Karel is an employee at a local agency. In order to generate extra income for his family, Karel initiated a pig breeding business a year ago. He bought four piglets, using his savings. He said that the reason he initiated the business is because he realized that he will retire from his job soon but he still needs to pay his children’s school fees, which are increasing every year. 

Karel needs a loan for business improvement. He wants to buy more piglets to fatten and therefore he is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to fatten.

loans.name: Berawan Salak Permai Group

texts.en: From the last loan, Ni Kadek managed to get a profit of 700,000 IDR. The gain is very helpful to the family's finances as they are currently experiencing difficult times due to increasingly expensive necessities of life. Ni Kadek, with Berawan Salak group, decided to continue borrowing from MUK because the loan was especially helpful in developing the pig businesses. This loan will be used to buy two superior piglets and pig feed. She hope this business can support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Otgonshagai

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonshagai is 29 years old, single and lives with his friend. They have a business of installing transforming stations by tender. Sometimes it runs successfully and sometimes not, and business is interrupted for months when they have no job orders. Also it depends on some seasonal reasons, because summertime job orders are raised notably. 

Now they need to renovate some of their equipment for a job. It is very important for their job performance in the future. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the some new equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase some new equipment for his business

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en:
Jeanelyn is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Jeanelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jeanelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jeanelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Mamadou Lamara

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou  Lamara est âgé de 31 ans et vit au Sénégal. Il est célibataire et exerce une activité  très diversifiée. D’ abord, il s’active dans le commerce de produits alimentaires divers  dans une boutique, ensuite il évolue dans l’animation des cérémonies et enfin s’active aussi dans la maçonnerie. Il a une expérience de 02 ans dans ses activités. Mamadou  Lamara veut diversifier ses sources de revenus, raison pour laquelle  il a choisi toutes ces activités.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les revenus que lui génèrent ses activités. Il  est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC  de la localité ou il exerce ses activités depuis aout 2008. Il sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits alimentaires qu’il va commercialiser, il souhaite renforcer le stock de la boutique qu’il vient d’acquérir.
texts.en: Mamadou Lamara is 31 years old and lives in Senegal. He is single and has very diversified activities. First, he sells a variety of food products in his shop, but he is also building up an activity providing entertainment at ceremonies and finally he is also active in the building trade. He has two years' experience in these activities. He wants to diversify his income sources, hence his choice to carry out all these activities. It is mainly the income that his activities generate that interests him most. He has been a member of the U-IMCEC branch in the town where he carries out his activities since 2008. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 francs so that he can buy food products which he will sell; he would like to boost the stock of the shop he has just acquired.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell in his shop

loans.name: Yan Carlos

texts.es: Yan de 26 años está muy satisfecha con su anterior credikiva, porque logró comprar materias  primas como lubricantes y también implementos de trabajo con los que mejoró la efectividad de su llantería,  ahora ofrece un mejor servicio y precios más competitivos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el que comprará herramientas, lubricantes en mayor volumen, para obtener mejores precios y para continuar siendo efectivo en su respuesta, consiguiendo finalmente obtener mayores ganancias. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por todo el apoyo y colaboración incondicional a microempresarios como yo, que desean seguir creciendo y contribuyendo con la economía de mi país “Colombia” “Muchas bendiciones y felicidades des deseo de corazón. “
texts.en:
Yan, who is 26 years old, is very satisfied with his last Kiva loan because he was able to buy raw materials, like lubricant and work tools, with which he improved the efficacy of his tire shop. Now he offers better service and more competitive prices.

Right now he is applying for a new Kiva loan with which he will buy tools and lubricant at a higher volume, to be able to get better prices and to continue giving good service, and finally to be able to earn more.  His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: “Thank you for all the help and your unconditional collaboration with small businessmen like me, who want to keep growing and contributing to the economy of my country, Colombia. I wish you blessings and happiness from the bottom of my heart.”

loans.use: to buy tools and lubricant at a greater volume.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella siembra maiz,papa,cebada y habas y luego los vende en el mercado,tambien la socia se esta dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ganados,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la papa,cebada,maiz y habas y ampliar el negocio de compra y venta de ganados.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y un ganado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is still working in agriculture. She plants corn, potatoes, barley, and beans and later sells them in the market. She also buys and sells cattle. With these businesses she gets her children ahead. Her dream is to have a locale where she can sell the potatoes, barley, corn and beans and to expand the business of buying and selling cattle. She is asking for the loan to buy seeds and a head of cattle.

She is happy with the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a wedding gown, cosmetics and more stocks for her kiosk.

loans.name: Breiner

texts.es: Breiner de 23 años de edad, genera sus propios ingresos mediante una actividad comercial en la ciudad de Cartagena. Su negocio  lo inició desde hace 4 años ayudando a su tía en la atención de una tienda de su propiedad, cuando su tía se enfermó gravemente, se la alquiló a él y hoy genera ingresos con los que paga a su tía, le queda para su auto sostenimiento y para la adquisición de sus propios equipos. Cada día su negocio es más suyo y quiere lograr tener la infraestructura suficiente para poder ser totalmente independiente. Breiner vende ranchos, víveres  y artículos de la canasta familiar,  así como también refrescos. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para lograr su propósito de hacerla crecer y hacer compras de contado que le  generen precios más óptimos en los artículos que vende. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará arroz, azúcar, aceite, refrescos y otros víveres para tener un mejor surtido y seguir conquistando nuevos clientes, que son los que finalmente hacen sostenibles su negocio. Su mayor sueño es tener su propia vivienda y lograr cada día más autonomía productiva.
texts.en: Breiner is 23 years old and generates his own income as a merchant in the city of Cartagena. He started his business 4 years ago helping his aunt with a store she owned. When his aunt fell gravely ill, she rented it to him and today he generates income that he pays his aunt with. He makes enough to support himself and to acquire his own equipment. Every day the business belongs to him more and he wants to be able to have enough infrastructure to be able to be totally independent. Breiner sells food, groceries and basic family basket items as well as beverages. Right now he doesn't have enough working capital to meet his goal of growing and paying for things upfront which will bring optimal prices for the items he sells. That is why he turned to a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, he will buy rice, sugar, oil, beverages and other groceries to have a better selection and keep getting new customers, which will finally make his business sustainable. His biggest dream is to own his own home and become more autonomous every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, drinks and other groceries to have a better selection.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene  de 48 años es una mujer casada que tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 17 a 28 años. Ella vive en el municipio de Soledad a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  allí tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres y artículos de la canasta familiar.  Su negocio inició hace 23 años, cuando aprendió de su esposo, propietario de la tienda y ella decidió ayudarlo en la tarea rutinaria de vender hasta el día de hoy. Con este negocio han logrado el sostenimiento de su familia y de ello se sienten muy satisfechos. Sus ventas las realizan diariamente de contado y con algunos pocos créditos y sus compras la realizan de contado. En su tienda ofrecen diversos productos como aceite, arroz, harina, azúcar, café, refrescos, verduras y carnes. En la actualidad planean su crecimiento incluyendo en su exhibidor artículos de misceláneas,  como adornos femeninos, detalles para el hogar, útiles de papelería etc. pero su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para comprar en volumen y ganar descuentos importantes. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hacen a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancías variadas, calzado, cosméticos, jabones, accesorios femeninos para el hogar y útiles de papelería, pues su meta mas adelante  es lograr tener un local independiente de su tienda, que se encuentre bien ubicado para vender especialmente productos de miscelánea y generar una nueva oportunidad de ingresos que beneficien el desarrollo y bienestar de su familia..
texts.en:
48 year old Marlene is a married woman who has four children, ages 17 to 28 years. She lives in the county of Soleded, 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. There she has a shop where she sells food,  provisions, and goods from the family shopping cart. She started her business 23 years ago, when she met her husband, proprietor of the store, and she decided to help him with the daily sales work from then until today. 

With this business they have been able to sustain their family, and they are very happy about that. They make their sales daily by payment on delivery, and with a few loans and their purchases they make the payments. They offer many diverse items in their shop, like oil, rice, flour, sugar, coffee, drinks, vegetables, and meat. 

Right now they are planning their store's expansion, including having miscellaneous items in their display, like accessories, home goods, paper items, etc, but their business capital is insufficient for large-scale purchase to get important discounts. 

This is why they are getting a Kiva loan, the first loan they have done with the Maria Santo Domingo Foundation, through which they will purchase varied merchandise, shoes, cosmetics, soaps, accessories for the home and paper goods, since their goal is to be able to have their own store location, which would be well-located to sell miscellaneous products especially and have new opportunities for income, which would benefit the development and wellbeing of their family.

loans.use: to buy varied merchandise, shoes, cosmetics, soaps, feminine accents for the home, and paper goods.

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.en:
Ni Luh, 49, lives in the village with her husband and her two grandchildren. Her husband works as a farmer. She has three adult sons and they live in the city. Besides farming, Ni Luh has a store business in her house. She built a room beside her house and displays her merchandise there. Because she has many customers, she often cannot meet demand. 

To enhance her store, she borrowed the funds from MUK. The loan will be used to buy daily needs items like rice, oil, soap, school supplies, herbs, snacks and more. By completing the merchandise, she hopes to satisfy her customers and get a lot of profit. With the profits she earns, she plans to enlarge her store and fix her kitchen.

loans.use: To buy daily needs items to stock her store.

loans.name: Begilda

texts.en:
Begilda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Begilda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Begilda has been a member of HSPFI since 1998. In the future, Begilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 52 años de edad es una mujer casada  que tiene un hijo en la edad de 28 años. Ella es comerciante, actividad a la que se dedica desde el año 1997, cuando empezó vendiendo juguetes, cremas, papelería, impulsada por su esposo quien le regaló una vitrina. En la medida en que crecía su clientela, fue agregando diversas mercancías y así mismo sus ventas se incrementaron. Hoy en su negocio cuenta con una clientela fiel, que la reconoce y le refiere nuevos compradores. Martha con sus utilidades también ha puesto una venta de  helados,  bolis y ha agregado a su oferta de mercancía  calzado y productos de belleza y  hasta ofrece el servicio de llamadas a celulares, e internacionales, contado con 4 equipos para hacerlo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen que el acostumbrado, calzado, productos de belleza, papelería y recipientes plásticos, artículos que rotan rápidamente y hacen que su inversión tenga éxito, porque adicionalmente gana descuentos por compras de contado y en mayor volumen.
texts.en: Martha is a 52 year old married woman with a 28 year old son. She is a merchant, something she has done since 1997. When she started selling toys, creams, paper products, she was supported by her husband, who bought her a display case. As her clientele grew, she added different types of merchandise and her sales increased. Today her business has a faithful clientele that recognizes her and refers her to new customers. With her profits Martha has also started selling ice cream, pens, and has added shoes and beauty products to her merchandise. She even offers a cell phone and international calling service and has 4 phones to do it with. Right now she is applying for a new Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy more than the usual amount of shoes, beauty products, paper products and plastic containers. these items have a fast turnover and will make her investment successful, because she will have discounts for paying upfront and in bigger quantities.

loans.use: to buy a larger volume than normal of shoes, beauty products, paper products and plastic containers.

loans.name: Pigy Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Pigy Lestari group decided to continue to borrow from MUK. Although some of them lost, they kept their spirits up to run their businesses. The settlement was attended by eight members because two members had a ceremony at the temple.

Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase two superior piglets. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Komang will combine it with traditional food. She hopes this time the pigs will grow fast and fat, so she will get a good price for them.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets.

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
Although the group earned a good profit from the last loan, they still need a new loan for their businesses because their have a strong will to become  successful pig businesses. 

The loan will be used to improve their businesses by allowing them to buy superior piglets or a sow.

Sayu Komang will use the loan to buy two superior piglets at 900,000 IDR. She has a plan to maintain one of them to become a sow. She wants to become a piglet seller in her village. She hopes MUK and Kiva will always support her and the group, not only for the loan but with training also.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.
 
Helen has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. 

She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo,cebada,habas y maiz,ella vende en el mercado desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos secos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos como maiz,habas y trigo al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues to sell dried goods such as wheat, corn, and potatoes at the market from 6am to 5 pm, through this business the member gets her children ahead, her dream is to expand the business of selling dried goods.  She is seeking a loan to buy dried goods in bulk such as corn, beans and wheat. Epifania is happy to get a loan and promises to pay back the loan according to the established schedule.
